Her customers visit her every afternoon from Monday to Sunday. Mrs. Waleska is requesting $525 to buy cheese, soft cheese, butter and condiments. Through this activity, Mrs. Waleska intends to obtain larger earnings and she will support her daughters that are studying this way. 

Mrs. Waleska's goal is also to open a patio to better serve her customers.

Mrs. Waleska dreams of giving her two daughters a good education so that they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase cheese, butter, soft cheese and condiments for her business.

loans.name: Bertha Marina

texts.es:
La señora Berta de 44 años de edad, es casada, vive con una de sus dos hijas en su casa en Valle al sur de Honduras, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y le apoya económicamente.
Doña Berta desde hace 20 años se ha dedicado a la confección de prendas para damas como trajes, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, etc., con esta actividad a podido sacar delante a su  familia, esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras para compra de telas, botones, hilos y otros accesorios para confeccionar los trajes, 
Doña Berta pretende que con las utilidades de este préstamo invertido en su negocio mejorara sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, Ella desea que su negocio crezca y que su familia prospere. 
El sueño de Doña Berta es tener su casa con piso de cerámica.
texts.en:
Bertha is 44 years old, is married and lives with one of her two daughters in her house in San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. Her husband is a mason and he supports her economically.

For twenty years, Bertha has dedicated herself to the creation of clothing for women like suits, dresses, skirts, pants, etc. Through this activity she has been able to get ahead with her family. She is requesting $525 to buy fabrics, buttons, threads and other accessories to create the suits.
Bertha intends to use the proceeds of this loan, invested in her business, to better the condition of her life and the life of her family. She desires for her business to grow and for her family to prosper.

Bertha's dream is to have a house with a ceramic floor.

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons, threads and other accessories for her business.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Libertad 1 Group

texts.es:
Doña   María  es  una   persona  muy  emprendedora,  dedicada  a su  negocio actualmente  tiene  su  vivienda  cerca   con  su madre  y tres hijas. Ella vive en el departamento de Choluteca al sur de Honduras.
Doña María es panadera elabora y vende de pan. Ella necesita el préstamo para la compra harina, huevos, azúcar, leña y manteca. Doña María espera que con este préstamo tener más pan en variedad con esto aumentar sus ventas.   Doña María Sueña con educar a sus hijas y poner una panadería grande y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes para que sus panes se vendan en mas lugares. 
La joven Lesly se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de una empresa, ella se dedica a este rubro desde hace más de 5 años y vive con sus padres.
La Señora Deysi se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en su caserío. Desde  hace mas de 10 años, ella madre de 2 hijos los que tiene de corta edad cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres y actualmente vive con ellos.

Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo  del 2012
texts.en:
Maria is a very entrepreneurial person and dedicates herself to her current business that she has near her home with her mother and three daughters. She lives in the south of Honduras. Maria is a baker and she produces and sells bread. She needs the loan to buy flour, eggs, sugar, wood and lard. Maria hopes that with this loan she will have a larger variety of bread and that this will increase her sales. Maria dreams of educating her daughters, of running a larger bakery and of satisfying the needs of her clients so that she can sell her bread in more places. 

The youngster Lesly dedicates herself to the sale of cosmetics as a business. She has dedicated herself to this task for more than 5 years and she lives with her parents.

Deysi dedicates herself to the sale of consigned clothing in her hamlet and has done so for more than 10 years. She is the mother of two sons that she had when she was very young and she counts on the support of her parents with whom she lives with today.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, sugar, wood and lard for their business.

loans.name: Suhad

texts.en:
Suhad is conservative person she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet thus the man inthe photo is her brother.
Suhad is  a 30-year-old woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan.

Suhad is looking to improve her family's living conditions by requesting a loan of 800 JD for doing maintenance on her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is married and runs a green grocery stall which has been operating for the last twenty-three years. Besides this, Martha is a farmer and also sells clothes. 

Martha sold some of her farm produce to obtain capital for the current business. She joined Milango to access credit for further business expansion and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional clothes to sell. 

Her future ambition is to own a parcel of land and construct a house. The challenges she needs to overcome are the high cost of transportation and the related fees she pays the government while operating the businesses.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina lives in the coastal town of Changamwe. She is a married mother of three children and runs a food stall marketing meat directly from the slaughter houses. She started the business from an $18 capital.

Tina faces the challenge of lack of proper storage methods and would like to have storage facilities and proper display. The others are fragile business climate and some clients not paying on time. She also looks forward to owning a soft drinks depot. Tina is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase/rent a coca cola sales agency. This will help increase her income/earnings for the developments she aspires to make.
Her customers have continued to grow and her ambition is to build a permanent stall.

loans.use: To purchase/rent a coca cola sales agency.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is from the Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is sixty-five years old. Lydia is married and has three children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a manufacturing business, manufacturing and selling products to local businesses and community members. Lydia has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Lydia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the labor cost of product manufacture. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost of product manufacture

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man.  He has 4 children and 3 are enrolled in school. Said operates a coconut selling business and sells his goods wholesale. He has worked in this business for 4 years and was previously employed as a seller of fried fish. His primary customers are coconut firms. Said's other source of income includes a motorcycle repairs business. He describes his greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation.  His highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Said will use the Kes 25000 loan to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. Said aspires to increase his number of coconuts to supply more in the future.  He joined Yehu to access funds.

loans.use: buy coconuts

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en:
Samphors (in the photo) is 41 years old and her husband Sot is 48 years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1987 and have three sons--one is a teacher, another studies pedagogy, and the other attends primary school. 

Samphors sells grocery items and sugarcane juice at her home, while her husband is a rice farmer. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her son who studies pedagogy to drive to school. He will become a teacher.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to school.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna (in the photo) is 41years old and her husband, Thol is 47 years old, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married 1987 and have three sons and two daughters. All of their children are garments workers.  

Vanna is a garment worker, while her husband is a rice farmer and raises cow at home. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike for children to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to get work.

loans.name: Lyda

texts.en:
Lyda (in the photo), age 37, sells food and Chines noodle and coffee. Her husband, Bunthon, age 35, is assisting his wife in the business. They live on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they just have two children-one son who is still young and one daughter who is in school. 

Lyda is asking for a loan of $1,500 to purchase a cow to raise. She will get extra income from selling cow for beef or sale for calf when the cow gives a baby.

loans.use: To purchase cow to raise.

loans.name: Sinuon

texts.en:
Sinuon (in the photo), age 49, is a weaver and does farming when farming season come. Her husband, Sotheavy, age 46, is a house constructor. They live on an island of Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have six children-two sons and four daughters. Four are married and live separately, one is a garment worker and another one is a hairdresser.  

Sinuon is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy more materials for her daughter’s beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her daughter’s beauty salon.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan (in the photo), age 31, is a house constructor. His wife, Rina, age 27, is a weaver. They have been married since 2005 and just have one young daughter. They live on an island of Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.   

Chan is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy more construction materials for his house construction business. He will also use a part of the loan to repair the house where he lives because his house breaks in some part.

loans.use: To buy more construction materials and repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak (in the photo), age 32, is a construction worker. His wife stays at home. She wants to launch business-selling food and coffee and build shelter to shade. Hence, Vannak decides to apply for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to help capital his wife. 
 

Vannak and his wife have been married since 2005 and they have two young daughters. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers form Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: To help capital his wife to launch business-selling food and coffee and build shelter to shade.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny (pictured here) and her husband, Sam on, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City and they have seven children-five sons and two daughters. One is married and lives separately, one is a driver, one is a garment worker, another one workers for a bakery and two attend school and another one is still young. 

Ny sells fish that her husband catches. Her husband is a fisherman and a motor taxi driver. He hopes to change his business from motor taxi driver to remoque driver, because it can carry more goods and people than a motor taxi. Hence Ny decides to ask for a loan of $400 to buy a trailer for her husband. 

A remoque is a motorbike connected with a trailer at the back.

loans.use: To buy a trailer for her husband.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Nara (in the photo) now sells meat balls and boiled duck eggs at home and she sells fish that her husband catches in her local market. Her husband is a fisherman. In the past, Nara used to be a garment worker. The couple has been married since 1993 and they have two children
who are in school. They live in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

The walls of Nara’s are old and break, she wants to make the repairs. Hence, Nara is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000.

loans.use: To repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea (in the photo with her loom) is 38 years old and her husband; Panha is 31 years old, live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2010 and have no children yet.

Sophea is a silk weaver, while her husband is a security guard. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to get work. She will also use a part of the loan to buy silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to get work and buy silk materials for her silk weaving business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is an ambitious 23-year-old man living in Kagadi, Uganda. For two years he has been operating a retail shop. He opened his shop after he saved enough income from his brick-laying activities. His challenges include price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand. He has dreams of educating his children and buying land to grow crops. Patrick needs the loan to buy groundnuts for resale.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Kyakahirwa Kayemba Association Group

texts.en: Herbert is a30-year-old hardworking man and a member of the above-mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing the loan. For a year, he has been growing maize and his previous harvest was very fruitful. His challenge is unpredictable seasonal weather and his dream is to buy land to grow more crops. Herbert needs the loan to buy maize for planting.

loans.use: to  buy maize to plant

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
Doña Sonia es casada, tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 3 hijas, su esposo se dedica a la ganadería, ella es una persona muy amable, servicial y alegre, y tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación. Hace algunos años comenzó vendiendo golosinas pero hace tres años inicio el negocio de la pulpería vendiendo productos como ser: azúcar, arroz, manteca, frijoles y otros productos de uso domestico, luego fue surtiendo su negocio con otros productos que los mismos clientes le recomendaban vender. 
Inicio a trabajar por cuenta propia y en el transcurso del tiempo aprendió a manejar su negocio, su horario de atención inicia a partir de las 5:30 a.m y culmina a las 9:00 p.m. Sonia solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de productos como ser: arroz, azúcar, manteca, sal, frijoles, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá surtir su negocio y seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos para poder apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia. Su meta es poner una bodega en la Ciudad de Juticalpa. Doña Sonia tiene 5 ciclos de recibir el apoyo de FAMA mediante los préstamos obtenidos y ha mantenido un  buen comportamiento de pago.
texts.en:
Sonia is married, 40 years old and has 3 children. Her husband makes a living in livestock farming. She is a kind, helpful, and cheerful person. She has a small grocery store in her home. Several years ago, she began selling candy but three years ago she started the grocery store business, selling products such as sugar, rice, lard, beans and other domestic use products. Then she began stocking her business with other products that her customers recommended she sell.

She began working a self-employed businesswoman and in time she learned to manage her business, with her working hours from 5:30am to 9:00pm. Sonia is requesting this loan in order to invest in buying products such as rice, sugar, lard, salt, and beans among others. 

With the help of this loan, she will be able to stock her business and continue to have a source of income to help her husband with family expenses.Her goal is to have a small grocery store in the city of Juticalpa. Sonia is in her fifth loan cycle of receiving support from FAMA through the loans she has obtained. She has maintained a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, lard, soap and other items

loans.name: Gloria Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Gloria, tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos, ella vive con su familia en una Aldea, sus hijos le acompañan en su negocio y su casa y su esposo se dedica a su taller de Carpintería en el departamento de Francisco Morazán.
El negocio de Doña Gloria  es la venta de golosinas como tacos, enchiladas, pastelitos de carne, catrachas, pollo frito, carne asada, pescado frito, refrescos, jugos, agua, entre otros productos.
Doña Gloria esta solicitando la cantidad de 8,000.00 lempiras para la compra de productos para elaborar golosinas y comida como Carnes, Pescado, Harina, Manteca, Verduras y condimentos.
Con el apoyo de este tipo de créditos comprara productos para abastecer su negocio y lograr incrementar el nivel de sus ingresos y aumentar sus clientes.
Entre los planes de Doña Gloria esta expandir su negocio, ya que le gustaría acondicionar más su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old, married and has two children.  She lives with her family in a village.  Her children accompany her at work and at home and her husband works in his carpentry shop in Francisco Morazán Department.

Gloria’s business is selling snacks like tacos, enchiladas, meat pies, “catrachas” {fried corn tortilla with beans, “chismol” [chopped tomatoes, onion and cilantro with lemon and spices] sauce, cilantro marinated tomatoes, red onion and grated dry cheese}, fried chicken, grilled meat, fried fish, soft-drinks, juice and water, among other products.

Gloria is asking for the amount of 8000 lempiras to buy ingredients to make snacks and food like meats, fish, flour, lard, vegetables and condiments.  With support from this type of loan she will buy products to stock her business and increase her income level and number of customers.   Among Gloria’s plans is to expand the business since she’d like to better equip it.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, flour, lard, vegetables and condiments.

loans.name: Kleber Alberto

texts.es: Kleber de 37 años vivve ( Quevedo ecuador ) el decidió ponerse el negocio de restaurant por que le da mayor rentabilidad y no le gusta ser empleado.  El trabaja todos los días solo de 7:00 a 2pm con mucho esfuerzo. A futuro el desea mejorar su vivienda y darle lo mejor a su hijo . con el préstamo comprara ( viveres ) carnes, arroz, aceite.
texts.en: Kleber, 37, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  He decided to start up a restaurant business because it is profitable, and he did not like being an employee.  He works on his own every day from 7am until 2pm with a lot of effort.  In the future, he wants to make some improvements to his house and provide the best for his child.  With this loan, he will buy food supplies including meat, rice and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn and her husband, Hieng, live in a village about 30 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have seven children-three sons and four daughters. Three are married and live separately, two are garment workers and other are in school.  

Soeurn and her husband rice farmers. In addition, Soeurn’s husband also purchases, raising, and selling cows. He wants to expand his business by buying additional cows to raise. Hence, Soeurn is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help her husband’s capital. 

Photo: Soeurn is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy additional cows for resale.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha (pictured here) is 46 years old and her husband; Koemthong is 45 years old, live in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers and they have four children-two sons and two daughters. Two are married and live separately and other two are in school. 

Chantha stays at home. The main source of income is from her husband’s business. He operates battery charging business and he is a tractor repairman. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 materials for her husband’s tractor repairing business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
Ruos (in the photo with her daughter) and her husband, Kheng are fishermen. In addition, they also grow rice when rice farming season come. The couple has been married since 2002 and they have three children-two sons and one daughter. Two are in school and another one is still young. 

Ruos is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy additional fishing materials and to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing materials and to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Yin (pictured here) is a construction worker and his wife, Yet is a rice farmer. And he also assists his wife in rice farming when he is free. The couple lives in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers and they have seven children-one son and six daughters. Five are married and live separately and others are garment workers. 

Yin is asking for a loan of $700 to buy pipes and water pumping machine to spray his rice farm.

loans.use: To buy pipes and water pumping machine to spray his rice farm.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Lai (pictured here), age 65, is a widow with four sons and two daughters. Four are married and live separately, one is a construction worker and another one has full-time employment. She lives on an island on Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Lai stays at home. The main source of income is from her son who is a construction worker and her daughter who has full-time employment. She is asking for a loan of $1,100 to buy a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Ran (pictured here), age 28, is a taxi driver. His wife, Srei Lors, age 24, is a hairdresser. The couple lives in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers and they have one young daughter.  

Ran is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to repair his taxi. Because his taxi’s spare part breaks, this upset his business.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 24-year-old woman. She has a one-year-old son. She describes herself as a hardworking and determined woman. 

Stella does dairy farming and sells milk in an area conducive to the general public. She has been in this business for one year. In addition, Stella  also provides rental housing services to increase her income. She works hard to support her family. 

Stella is facing a challenge of inadequate funds to expand her business. She plans to and will use the loan of KES 20,000 to pay for the renovation of her rental houses.  Stella's dream and hope is to expand her business in the next five years.

loans.use: renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Sokmaly

texts.en:
Sokmaly (pictured here), age 54, is a weaver. Her husband, Phy, age 56, is a house constructor. In addition, the couple also grows rice when rice farming season come. They live in a village along Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. And they have twelve children-six are married and live separately, two have full-time employment, one is a garment work and two are monks and another one attends school. 

Sokmaly is asking for a loan of $300 to put additional of her house.

loans.use: To put additional of her house.

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en:
Khadra is a 41-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan. she is the mother of seven children.
Khadra hs a home based project she sells cosmotics, now she is planning to purchase a refridgerator so that she is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to improve her family life's conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new fridgerator for her home.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 56 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, además de ser muy amable y trato jovial. Está casada con Roberto quien es artesano y padre de sus 2 hijos Wilson de 26 años y Neri de 19 años de edad.  Vive en compañía de su esposo, hijos mas sus 2 nietos, instalados en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Elena  es la venta de abarrotes en general y yucas, para eso abrió una bodega en su propia casa atendiendo amablemente a sus clientes. 
Empezó con un apoyo financiero de MFP, comprando en pequeñas cantidades, logrando crecer a base de esfuerzo, realizándola ella sola. Iniciándose hace más de 6 meses contando con el apoyo de su hijo en la atención al público consumidor.
Considera su negocio rentable por la ganancias que le deja, pues cuenta con una regular clientela.
Su negocio le permite estar en casa para poder atender a su pequeño hijo, así como los ingresos económicos que le sirven para comprar lo que le falte para su hogar, al contrario no le gusta que algunos de sus clientes le piden crédito y cuando llega el momento del pago se retrasan. Por tanto tiene deseos de  crecer y ampliar su bodega hasta convertirla en un bazar donde pueda vender toda clase de productos. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría, aun existe el ingreso de algunos nuevos, espera que sean responsables como el resto del grupo. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor para su bodega, como azúcar, arroz, aceites y otros. También de yucas ya que los precios de éste producto están al alza, dejándole mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elena, age 56, is a cheerful and hard-working woman, and she also has a very kind and jovial manner.  She is married to Roberto, a craftsman and father of their two children.  Wilson is 26 years old, and Neri is 19 years old.  She lives with her husband, her children, and two grandchildren in her own house.

Elena’s business is selling general groceries.  She opened a grocery store in her house in order to do this.  She also sells yuccas, and she kindly tends to her customers.  She started with financial support from MFP.  She purchased in small quantities, and she managed to grow from the foundation of hard work.  Over the time that she had her business she worked alone.  However, starting over six month ago she counts on her son’s help in waiting on the public.

She considers her business to be profitable because of the income it gives her, and because she has a regular clientele.  Her business allows her to be at home in order to be able to tend to her young child.  The financial income serves her to buy what she needs for her household.  On the other hand, she does not like that some of her customers ask for credit.  When it comes time to pay they put it off.  Even so, she sees that her business is well-received.  Therefore, she wishes to grow and expand her grocery store until she can convert it into a bazaar where she will be able to sell all types of products.

This will be her third loan with MFP.  She hopes for your collaboration so that she will be able to firm up her plans.  Also, she feels good with her communal bank.  She knows most of them, and new members are joining.  She hopes they will be as responsible as the rest of the group.  She will use the requested 2000 soles to buy wholesale groceries like sugar, rice, oil, and others for her grocery store.  She will also buy yuccas because the prices for this product are rising, which leaves her with greater income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, and yucca.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a responsible housewife who aims to improve her status of living and to give her children a better life. She is now 56 years of age and has three grown-up children. Due to financial burden, she helps her husband in managing their corn farming business to ensure a high production. They planned to expand their corn plantation to increase their yield and income to satisfy their necessities and save for future emergencies.   Despite the hardships they encountered in farming, they have the determination to work out their plan. 

Virginia is asking for an additional capital of PHP 46,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost in planting corn. She believes that the loan will help them to work out their plan and hopes that they will be having a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost in planting corn

location.town: Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a responsible mother who helps her husband in managing their rice farming business to ensure a high yield. She is now 40 years old and has five school-age children. Joy and her husband aim to improve their source of living to satisfy their family's needs and continue sending their children to school. They have been operating their business for almost 20 years, earning a profit of PHP 26,000 every harvest season. They utilize their income for their food, clothing and allowances for their children. 

Due to financial constraints, Joy is asking for an additional capital of PHP 49,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay the labor cost in transplanting rice. They believe that their patience and hard work will bear a fruitful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay labor cost

location.town: Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells from a food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children -- two of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo is from the village of Villa Concepcion. He is married and has two children. Ronaldo is engaged in his sari-sari store for five years. This is the only source of income for his family. That is why he works hard to uplift his family from poor living. 

Ronaldo wants to buy additional stocks of items to sell, but he lacks the necessary capital.  In this  regard, Ronaldo is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, sugar, vinegar, salt, bread, and daily use products to sell. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further develop his business.

loans.use: restock his store

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline lives in Yambio, South Sudan. She sells clothes, and has been in business for 5 years. She is 28 years old and married with two children, both of whom are still in school.

Eveline heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 400 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Furimuna

texts.en:
Furimuna lives in Yambio, South Sudan. She sells charcoal and has been in business for 3 years. She is 35 years old and married with two children, both of whom are still in school.

Furimuna heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan lives in Kator. She sells clothes and has been in business for four years. She is 36 year old, married, and has four children. All of them are still in school. 

Juan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 4,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nalweyo Scc Group

texts.en: Scovia is 43 years old and a married mother of 7 children.She opened a restaurant business which she has been running for 10 months and she has high hopes that the business will grow.She is a group member of Nalweyo SCC group and she faces a challenge of price fluctuation and high transport costs,her family goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand to new markets.Scovia needs the loan to buy tables and food for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and food for her restuarant.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El comité San Ramón nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas en lo personal como laboral.
La Sra. Maria es miembro del grupo, y cuenta con una despensa bien surtida, con la cual abastece a sus vecinos y personas de barrios aledaños. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que gracias al esfuerzo y sacrificio que le puso al negocio, ha podido salir adelante e ir creciendo de a poco.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, frutas, hortalizas, bebidas, panes, lácteos y demás insumos necesarios para poder abastecer su negocio y de esa forma seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group San Ramon was born through the management and support of another group in the same town. The group is in the city of San Lorenzo and the main objective of the members is growth - both personal and financial. 

Maria is a member of the group and she has a well-stocked store where her neighbors and people from nearby neighborhoods get their supplies. She tells us that she started with a small business, but thanks to her hard work and sacrifice she was able to get ahead and to grow her business little by little.

She asks for a loan to buy fruits, vegetables, drinks, bread, dairy products and other things she needs to stock her business and keep growing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, drinks, bread, dairy products and more.

loans.name: Falilatu

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Falilatu.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 16 and 4 yrs. She has 2 additional dependents.  

In 2010, Falilatu established her medical services business. She began her business because she was trained as a nurse and decided to start her own business in medicine. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

Falilatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.   She requires a loan in order to buy more medicine in a large quantity. In the future, Falilatu plans to build her own hospital that will be managed by herself.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy medicine

loans.name: Righteous Group

texts.en:
Haja sells market food: pepper, salt, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, etc. She has been a businesswoman for six years now. Haja was born in Makeni city, about 25 years ago. She is married to a student and the couple has one child who is attending primary school. 

Haja is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. With the help of this loan, Haja and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Haja will use her share of the loan (1,000,000 leones) to buy pepper, salt, Maggi, etc., in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy pepper, salt, Maggi, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Marcia Pilar

texts.es: Marcia de 44 años vive ( pariso Guayaquil ) ella decidió entrar al negocio de venta de artículos de belleza porque su mama le enseño a ser comerciante, tambien en ocasiones confecciona. Entonces ella decidió vender y le va bien . trabaja todos los días con muchas ganas el horario lo establece ella. A futuro anhela ser microempresaria . con el préstamo comprara ( productos de belleza, perfumes, cremas para mejorar sus ventas en cosmeticos)
texts.en:
Marcia, 44, lives in Paraíso, Guayaquil.  She decided to go into the business of selling beauty products because her mother taught her to be a storekeeper.  Then she decided to be a vendor, and it is going well for her.  Every day, with great desire, she works the schedule she sets up.  In the future she wants to be a micro-entrepreneur.

With the loan she will buy beauty products, perfume, and creams.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, perfume, creams, and dyes.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a conservative person she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet thus the man in the photo is her child.

Amal is a 46-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Amal is looking to improve her family's living conditions, so she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to to purchase a table for her personal computer and improve her house furnishings.

loans.use: to purchase a table for her personal computer and upgrade the furniture in her house

loans.name: Elkana

texts.en: Elkana is 26 years old and married with 3 children. He distributes water to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. He describes his customers as low income earners because they live in the slums. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and hopes to grow his business in the future. He has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a water tank.

loans.use: To buy a water tank.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is a 40-year-old who is married and has eight children. He operates a produce business, which he has run for a period of six years. At first, Mathias was in agriculture, harvesting beans and maize. Then he started his produce business and it has since improved steadily. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are factors affecting the business growth. 

He has a dream of educating his children and buying a car. He wishes to expand his business to other new markets and buy land for growing crops. He therefore wants a loan to buy maize, beans, and groundnuts for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, and groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 32 year old who is married with 4 children. Agriculture is his business, though he is a teacher by profession. He keeps pigs and cattle and also grows pineapples. He got start-up capital from his salary as a teacher. Seasonal weather affects his business growth.

Joseph wishes to expand his business to new markets and to diversify his business. He wants a loan to buy animal feed and expand his plantation. He has a dream of educating his children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and expand his plantation.

loans.name: Lebenia Maria

texts.es: Lebenia Maria tiene 40 años de edad, ella trabaja como responsable de estadística del centro de salud de la localidad donde habita, ya tiene años en ese puesto. Lebenia Maria tiene una vivienda donde ella ha querido realizarle algunas mejoras y por falta de dinero lo ha realizado. Lebenia Maria está solicitando financiamiento para poder cumplir su sueño que es de acondicionar su vivienda lo cual comprara zinc, arena, ladrillo, cemento entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Lebenia Maria, age 40, works as a statistician at the health center in the town where she lives.  She has had this position for years.

Lebenia Maria has a home where she has wanted to make some improvements.  She has not done so due to lack of money.  Lebenia Maria is requesting a loan to be able to fulfill her dream, which is to fix up her home.  To do so she will buy zinc, sand, bricks, cement, and other construction materials.

loans.use: to  buy zinc, sand, bricks, cement, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Zully Gioconda

texts.es: Zully de 39 años vive ( isla Guayaquil ). Ella empezó con la venta de colas y snack en el norte por que un familiar se lo recomendó. Le va bien y a incrementado su mercadería . trabaja todos los días sola . es soltera pero tiene tres hijos su esposo la abandono . Con el prestamo ella desea hacer su casa de dos plantas para mejorar su forma de vida.
texts.en:
Zully, 39, lives in Isla, Guayaquil.  She started this business in the north because a family member recommended it to her.  It is going well for her and she has increased her merchandise.  She works alone every day.  She is single but has three children.  Her husband abandoned her.  In the future she wants to make her house a two story.

With the loan she will buy sodas.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 52 year old who is married with children and who operates a retail business that he has run for a period of 10 years now. Peter was a fishmonger on Lake Albert first, then accumulated capital and started a retail business. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are factors affecting the growth of his business.

Peter wishes to expand his business to new markets and to diversify his business. He wants a loan to buy sodas, salt, and sugar for resale. He has a dream of educating his children and buying a car.

loans.use: to buy sodas, salt, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en: Hannington is a 50-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Cattle selling has been his business for 23 years. His challenges have included price fluctuations, inflation, and seasonal weather, which makes transport to his areas of trade difficult. His personal dream is to educate his children and build a permanent home. His business dream is to buy land to grow crops and expand his business into new markets. He needs the loan to buy cows for resale.

loans.use: to buy cows for resale

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a 28-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 6 years. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. 

Serah operates a retail store where she sells dresses, trousers, blouses, etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within a very busy shopping centre and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of clothes materials.  

Serah will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes materials to sell. Her business goal is to run another retail store within 5 years.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Savina

texts.en:
Savina is a 69-year-old married woman. She has 10 children with ages ranging from 28 years to 52 years. She describes herself to be ambitious, polite and kind. 

Savina operates a retail stall where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a competitive green area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. 

Savina will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more maize for selling. Her business goal is to be selling other types of cereals such as beans, black beans, etc. within 5 years.

loans.use: buy maie

loans.name: Shaga

texts.en:
Shanga is a 43-year-old woman who is married with four children. She is in the livestock trading business in Emali. She has been in the business for 14 years now and gets a monthly income of 4,000 shillings. 

This will be Shanga’s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan  to buy a solar kit to use to provide light in the house. In the future, she desire to grow his business and be able to become self reliant and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a solar kit for lightening purpose

loans.name: Filasteen

texts.en:
Filasteen is a conservative person, so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the Internet. The man in the photo is her husband.

Filasteen is a 22-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of two children.

Filasteen sells cleaning products and she is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase more quantities for trading purposes.

Filasteen is looking to open a shop for her business and to improve her family's life conditions.

Because Filasteen is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products for trading purposes.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 22-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan, and the mother of two children. Yasmeen is a conservative person. She is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet; thus, the man in the photo is her brother. Yasmeen is looking to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to paint her house. Because Yasmeen is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to paint her house

loans.name: Rosa  Alba

texts.es: Rosa Alba tiene 37 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a una pulpería que la tiene  ubicada en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes y les ofrece variedad de productos y una excelente atención. Esta emprendedora tiene cinco hijos con la ayuda de su esposo han sacado adelante a su familia brindándole lo mejor. Esta emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos para la pulpería como granos básicos,  jabón, detergentes, huevos, pan, entre otros productos que más le demandan sus clientes.
texts.en: Rosa Alba is 37 years old.  She runs a small grocery store for a living, which is located in her home, where she serves her customers and offers them a variety of products and excellent customer service.  This enterprising woman has five children and, with the help of her husband, they have gotten their family ahead, offering them the best.  This enterprising woman is asking for financing to buy products for the grocery store like staple grains, soap, detergents, eggs, and bread, among other products that her customers ask for most.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, soap, detergents, eggs, and bread, among other products her customers ask for most

loans.name: Tsedevdorj

texts.en:
Tsedevdorj is a 26-year-old man who lives with his wife and 2 children in the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is employed in small shop and takes after the young child. The son studies at the secondary school.

Tsedevdorj has been running taxi service business since 2006. He is an experienced driver and he earns around 50,000 - 60,000 MNT a day. This has been the only financial source for the family. He has a further plan to expand the business. Tsedevdorj is a talented driver who is also responsible for the family members and says that, "I would like to continue my business activity by replacing the van with a good one. I am planning to buy 'Sonata' van by the loan and the saved money." The total amount he is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy a new van.

loans.use: to buy a new van

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 37 years old and married with one child. He sells consumers goods to earn a living. Peter has been in the business for 3 years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people are in the same business. Peter does farming to earn extra income.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Peter  has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy consumer goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy consumer goods for sale.

loans.name: Layali

texts.en:
Layali is a 29-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan, and a mother of four children.

Layali sells clothes. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase more quantities for trading purposes.

Layali is looking to improve her family's life conditions and expand her business.

Because Layali is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal is a 50-year-old married man from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan, and a father of four children.

Faisal sells accessories and different kind of goods and products. He is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to purchase accessories for trading purposes.

Faisal is looking to purchase a bus for his business to distribute his products through it.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for trading purposes.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a 25-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan, and a mother of four children.
Hanadi is looking to improve her family's living conditions therefore she is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to to do maintenance work on her house.
As Hanadi is under 30 years old her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on her house.

loans.name: Augustine M.a.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are primary school teachers from the village of Malong in Northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan in order to solve their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the payments on their behalves. 

Augustine is the leader of this group. A native of Malal village, the 63-year-old man is married to a trader, and the couple has four children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Augustine has been a teacher for 45 years. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: G.s. Dios Nos Guia Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Dios Nos Guía, está conformado por dos emprendedoras que cada una de ellas tiene sus negocios son emprendedoras que han luchado por sacar a su familia adelante. Este grupo ya son clientes de Fundación León 2000, ya tiene un ciclo trabajando con créditos y han demostrado ser personas responsable y con deseos de superación. Maria Concepción es parte de este grupo su negocio es la venta de mercadería en general está solicitando financiamiento para comprar producto como pantalones, camisas, faldas, sandalias, camisas, blúmer, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Dios Nos Guía, is made up of two entrepreneurs, each of which owns her own business and has struggled to get her family ahead.This group is a client of Fundación León 2000.  They have been working with loans for one cycle and have proven to be responsible people who strive for self-improvement. 

Maria Concepción belongs to this group. Her business sells merchandise in general and she is requesting financing in order to purchase products such as pants, shirts, skirts, sandals, underpants, etc.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, sandals, underpants, and other products

loans.name: Lizeth Johana

texts.es:
Lizeth es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que desde muy corta edad viene trabajando fuertemente para poder generarse sus propios ingresos y contribuir económicamente en los ingresos de su hogar. Desde muy temprana edad aprendió la actividad de las ventas y posteriormente trabajó como mercaderista y cajera en un almacén. Adquirida la experiencia, decidió montar su propio negocio donde ofrece bolsos, zapatos y accesorios para dama, y gracias a esto ha podido progresar económicamente. Debido a que su negocio fue montado con muy bajo capital, Lizeth busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de accesorios para dama para surtir su negocio con una mayor variedad de mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio podrá aumentar las ventas considerablemente, y así seguir aportando económicamente en su hogar. Además, podrá cumplir su sueño de tener un gran negocio con diferentes sedes donde genere empleo para las personas más vulnerables y así también tener un ingreso estable para su familia.
texts.en:
Lizete is a very hardworking and enterprising person who has worked hard from a very young age to be able to generate her own income and contribute economically to the household income.  From a very young age she learned to work in sales.  Later she worked as a marketer and a cashier in a department store.  Once she acquired the experience she decided to set up her own business selling bags, shoes, and women's accessories.  Thanks to this she has been able to progress economically.

Because her business was set up with very low capital, Lizete is looking for a loan that gives her the opportunity to buy women's accessories to stock her business with a greater variety of merchandise to sell to her customers.  In this way her business will be able to increase sales considerably and continue contributing economically in her household.

In addition, she will be able to realize her dream of having a great business with different locations that generates employment for the most vulnerable people, as well as having a stable income for her family.

loans.use: to buy women's accessories to stock her business with a greater variety of merchandise for her customers.

loans.name: Fausto Joffre

texts.es: Fausto vive (paraiso ecuador). Ella le dieron oportunidad de trabajar en lo que mas le gustara y el escogió la panaderia. con esfuerzo logro acogerse de ese trabajo para poder sustentarse . ella trabaja todos los días  apartie de las 08:00 has la noche su trabajo lo realiza con ganas. a futuro ella quiere tener su vivienda . con el préstamo comprara  (Harina, huevos, azucar).
texts.en:
Pablo lives in Paraiso, Ecuador.  He was given the opportunity to work in a job he enjoys, so he decided to work in a bakery.  With great effort, he was able to achieve recognition for his work and support himself as a result.  He works every day from 8am to nightfall when his work is completed.  In the future, he wants to have a home.

This loan will be used to buy flour, eggs, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, and sugar.

loans.name: Ramon Enrrique

texts.es:
Don Ramón vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo  que esta ubicada al sur de Honduras el  cuenta con una edad de 33 años de edad el cual su trabajo es prestar el servicio de taxi en su ciudad, el trabaja de manera responsable en su propio vehículo.
Don Ramón se a dedicado ya hace varios años a este tipo de trabajo y esta solicitando 20,000.00 lempiras para poder comprar repuesto para su vehículo ya que necesita hacerle algunas reparaciones y  cambiarles algunas piezas, el cree que con el apoyo de este crédito su automóvil estará en muy buenas condiciones siendo esta la herramienta mas importante en sus ingresos, el sueño de Don Ramón es comprarse otro vehículo para ponerlo a trabajar y así lograr tener mas ganancia para mejorar su vida y poder tener un hogar mas digno.   



San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Don Ramón lives in the city of San Lorenzo, located in the south of Honduras. He is 33 and drives a taxi in his city. He is a responsible worker and owns his own vehicle.
Ramón has been in this line of work for several years. He is requesting a loan of 25,000 Lempiras for the purchase of spare parts for his vehicle; he needs to make some repairs and switch out some pieces. He believes that this loan will allow him to ensure that his vehicle is in very good condition. His vehicle is his most important tool for making an income. Ramón's dream is to buy another vehicle so that he can make more income in order to improve his life and get a better home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  March 2012

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle; he needs to make some repairs.

loans.name: Lestter Mauricio

texts.es: Lestter Mauricio es un emprendedor que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 20000, en crédito su negocio que desempeña es de brindar los servicios de transporte ya tiene años de estar en el negocio. Este emprendedor es un luchador con objetivos en la vida de salir adelante y que su unidad esté bien acondicionada para ofrecerles a sus clientes un buen servicio. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar un motor y una caja de cambio para el vehículo.
texts.en: Lestter Mario is an entrepreneur who has been working with Fundación León 2000 loans.  The business he carries out is providing transportation services.  He’s been in this business for years.  This entrepreneur is a tenacious man who has life goals to get ahead and that his vehicle is in good condition in order to offer his customers good service.  He’s currently asking for financing to buy an engine and a gear box for the vehicle.

loans.use: to buy an engine and a gear box for the vehicle.

loans.name: Mahuwetin Beatrice's Group

texts.fr: Mahuwetin Béatrice âgée de 29 ans, est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle vend de la nourriture dans sa baraque. Elle a sollicité un concours auprès de Finadev pour faire valoir ses prestations et pouvoir se prendre en charge et surtout envoyé toujours ses enfants à l'école.
texts.en: Mahuwetin Béatrice, aged 29, is married and the mother of three children. She sells food from a stand. She is requesting funds from Finadev to enhance her range of offerings and to be able to support herself and in particular to keep her children in school.

loans.use: a basket of condiments, a sack of corn, and a basket of fish

loans.name: Maria Adela

texts.en:
Maria Adela is 24 years old and single.  She has a four-year-old son and lives alone with him in the Salcedo area of Latacunga, Ecuador.  She describes herself as happy and friendly and has been working with dairy cows for six years.  Maria Adela started out with a single cow but has been expanding her business and learning the trade as time goes by.  

She now hopes to take out her first loan, which will help her buy another milk cow, something which she believes can help her raise her income level so that she can better provide for her small son.  Maria Adela's only wish for the future is to make enough to provide her son with a good education and a decent home.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Maria Brigida

texts.en:
Maria Brigida is a hardworking and happy 57-year-old widow who lives in the Salcedo area of Latacunga, Ecuador with her two sons. She began working with cattle about twenty-seven years ago and took out her first loan five years ago, which helped her a lot in buying more milk cows.  

She now hopes to take out another loan and expand her business even more. With the extra income, she hopes to be able to afford her sons' education and, with luck, in the future buy a small farm where her family can live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Ana Griselda

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos, se dedica a la venta de platillos típicos, tiene más de 5 años dedicándose al negocio, lo aprendió de su madre, la manera de vender es ambulante, desde las 3:00pm hasta las 7:00pm.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de yuca, papas, salsa, queso, aceite, que son los materiales  necesarios para la elaboración de los platillos típicos, este crédito le ayudara para invertir más en el negocio, su riesgo con la venta ambulante es la época de invierno, cuando por las tardes llueve y no les deja espacio para salir a vender.
Los sueños de Ana son mantener el negocio y crecer, ya que esto le permitirá mejorar los ingresos para sus padres.

loans.use: Compra de yuca, papas, salsa, queso, aceite.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel  tiene 51 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad de la provincia de Guanacaste llamada Guaitil. La economía de la zona de Guanacaste se fundamenta principalmente en la ganadería, aunque también en esta región se practican la apicultura y acuacultura.

Miguel se dedica al transporte de personas tanto a domicilio como también al público en general, con  lo cual le ha llevado el sustento diario a su familia , él es muy querido por los vecinos de la comunidad que usan su servicio de transporte.

En estos momentos lo que desea don Miguel es un  préstamo por ¢900,000(novecientos mil colones) ya que necesita comprar  repuestos a  su vehículo , pintarlo y hacerle varios arreglos ya que de este depende el trabajo y  por consiguiente la alimentación de su familia.

Don Miguel  es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Guaitil S.A, razón por la cual se siente  muy agradecido por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder seguir trabajando en transporte y de esta manera servir a la comunidad .
texts.en:
Miguel, 51, lives with his family in a community in Guanacaste Province called Guaitil.  The economy of the Guanacaste zone is mainly based on animal husbandry although bee raising and hydroponics are also practiced here.

Miguel provides transportation both door to door and to the public in general; he’s provided daily sustenance for his family this way.  He is very well liked by neighbors in the community who use his transportation service.

At present, Miguel needs a loan for ¢900,000 (nine-hundred thousand) colones because he needs to buy spare parts for his vehicle, to paint it and to do several repairs because he depends on it for work and consequently to feed his family.

Miguel is a member of the Guaitil S.A. communal bank which is why he’s grateful for the opportunities to access credit it provides and to be able to continue working in transportation thus being of service to his community.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married and has four children. She is 33 years old and resides in Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Angelina sells fish while her husband does the fishing to earn a living. She's been in this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. 

Angelina requested a loan of PHP15,000 to repair their fishing boat. Angelina joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Angelina wants to build a house and to finish the study of her children.

loans.use: repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Pachamama Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PACHAMAMA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por diez  integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Yolanda. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de refrescos y gelatinas, venta de aji, venta de comida, venta de polleras y enaguas, venta de pan, tienda de barrio, venta de busos y guantes, venta y producción de guantes.

La señora Yolanda, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal por primera vez, ingresando por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de gelatinas y frescos, que viene trabajando hace años. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de gelatina) mismos que adquirirá de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.

En la fotografía se puede identificar a dos socias que no aparecen totalmente, la señora Norah que se encuentra detras de la señora de sombrero verde y la señora Juana que se ubica en el costado derecho y solo aparese medio cuerpo.
texts.en:
The “PACHAMAMA” communal bank will start its first loan with Pro Mujer, as part of the Germán Busch Regional Office. It is made up of ten members and they have a board of directors, at the head of which is Yolanda. 

The businesses that the members of the bank undertake are varied, amongst which we have: sale of soft drinks and gelatine desserts, sale of aji (chilli), sale of food, sale of traditional Andean skirts and underskirts, sale of bread, a neighborhood shop, sale of thick pants for winter and gloves, and the sale and manufacture of gloves. 

Yolanda, who says that this is the first time she is part of a communal bank, joins upon the invitation of a member. Today she has a business selling gelatine desserts and soft drinks, which she has been doing for many years. 

The credit from this loan cycle is to extend the range of own merchandise (purchase of gelatine desserts) which she will obtain in the city of El Alto and then, once they are made, she will sell her merchandise during fiestas. This style of working enables her to support her family, given that she is married and has five children. 

When asked what it is she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health aspect.

In the photograph, two members who aren't fully visible can be identified: Norah who is found behind the woman with the green hat and Juana who is found on the right-hand side and you can only see half of her body.

loans.use: to buy gelatine desserts.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 27 years old and is married with four children under the age of 12.  

She has operated quarry business for one year whereby she mines stones and sell to the constructors. With this loan Virginia plans to hire more workers and lease a new quarry site.  

Her dream is to own multiple mining areas and give employment opportunities to her community.

loans.use: to hire more workers and lease new places for mining.

loans.name: David Acuna

texts.en:
Together, David and his wife own and operate a community daycare facility in Orlando, Florida. Both of them are driven entrepreneurs with the skills and experience in child care to run their own facility. David has various academic degrees in both education and pedagogy, as well as extensive teaching experience in his native Venezuela. Their daycare has been in operation for over three years now, and they both see it as more than just a daycare facility. It is a learning environment for the children. 

David sees this as one of the most important missions of his facility. He wants to engage the children and help them remain active physically and mentally while visiting his facility. This loan would help drive David's mission. He would like to purchase new equipment for the children of the daycare to use.

loans.use: To purchase more and newer equipment for his daycare

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: El solicitante es chofer que tiene un taxi propio, afiliado a la  Asociación de transpote de las 6 federaciones del trópico de Cochabamba, realizando su actividad en la zona del Chapare, Sacaba y otras zonas aledañas a Cercado. Trabaja hace 5 años con transporte, paralelamente la esposa (codeudora) trabaja con el comercio de papa, vende 3 veces a la semana, realizando la compra en Sacaba y comunidades vecinos de su morada, vendiendo a su clientela que le demanda cada semana, son las dos actividades que  generan ingresos suficientes a la familia mensualmente, demostrando que tiene capacidad de pago para el presente crédito. El sr. Caballero solicita el crédito para realizar mejoras en su vivienda de modo de dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Martin is a taxi driver who has his own car. He is affiliated with the transportation association comprised of the six federations in the Cochabamba region. He works mainly in the Chapare, Sacaba, and other zones surrounding Cercado.

Martin began working in transportation five years ago. His wife works selling potatoes, and sells them three times per week after purchasing them in Sacaba and neighboring communities. She sells her products to her clients who demand them. These two jobs provide the income for their family, and prove that they have the ability to pay back this loan.

Martin is requesting this loan to make improvements to his home, which will in turn provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to complete construction and repair work on his home.

loans.name: Kanda

texts.en:
Kanda, 29, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been breeding pigs to sell for over six years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband runs the business of buying junk materials to resell at the junk shop. He earns approximately USD 4 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s economy, Kanda is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase farmland for growing agricultural crops. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to breed more pigs and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees. The man in the picture is kanda's husband.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for growing agricultural crops.

loans.name: Honorine Sèdè's Group

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Honorine Sèdè est la responsable d'un groupe de deux personnes. Elle a une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des mèches, des produits cosmétiques, des pagnes et autres articles. Elle s'approvisionne sur les marchés de la place. Pour étendre son activité et répondre aux préoccupations de sa clientèle, elle fait recours au financement de Finadev afin de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. La responsable est celle qui se retouve à droite de la photo.
texts.en: Honorine Sèdè is married and the mother of four children.  She is the representative of a group made up of two people.  She has a shop in which she sells hair extensions, cosmetic products, some "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) and other items.  She buys her goods at a local market.  In order to expand her business and to meet the needs of her customers, she is requesting a loan from Finadev.  This loan will allow her to maximize her profits and to contribute to her children's school fees.  Honorine Sèdè is the woman standing in the photograph on the right.

loans.use: to buy 20 cosmetic products and 10 "pagnes" of all kinds.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.es: El cliente, Erwin, es un señor de 30 años de edad, es soltero, trabaja en una empresa de Criadores y engorde de ganado lechero en la ciudad de Cochabamba, que  queda ubicado en la zona este de la ciudad, actualmente el cliente vive por la zona oeste, aproximadamente a 2 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente es propia, el cliente vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijas, el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la refacción de su vivienda, la cual ya está muy desgastada por el transcurso del tiempo, la humedad que causo en la parte inferior de las paredes de la vivienda por las lluvias constantes en la ciudad, así mismo el suelo por la humedad se está rajando de su domicilio, ya que es la época del tiempo y la vivienda ya necesita hacer el respectivo mantenimiento,  es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia del cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en:
The client, Erwin, is a 30 year old, single man.  He works for a firm that raises dairy cattle in the city of Cochabamba located in the eastern part of the city.  He lives in the western part about 2 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  The house he lives in is his and he lives with his wife and two daughters.

He will use the new loan from the institution to do some home repairs which is much deteriorated due to the passage of time.  The bottom part of the walls of the house are damaged because of dampness caused by the city’s constant rains as well as the very floor of the house that’s cracking due to dampness since this is the season of weather and the house needs to be repaired.  This is why we relate this small story about the client for all of you to be aware of.

loans.use: to repair his house.

loans.name: Peterson M.'s Group

texts.en:
In the photo above are teachers of a primary school in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. These diligent and hard-working teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 10,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to help them pay school fees for their children, invest in businesses, buy pieces of furniture, buy a plot of land, etc. 

At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school's bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

Peterson is the leader of this group of teachers. The 50-year-old is a native of Ganya Sulima village. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children. Peterson has served in the teaching profession for 29 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials like bags of cement, iron, corrugated zinc, etc. for the construction of a house. He will also use part of the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the construction of a house, and to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis, quiere seguir creciendo, por eso está decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para salir a vender especias, para atender otras zonas, comprara más productos en cominos, achiotes, canela, orégano, semillas, entre otras hierbas que son utilizadas en la cocina.
Él manifiesta haber tenido un efecto positivo de la inversión anterior, porque le permitió comprarse lo necesario en mercadería,  para salir a ofrecer a los clientes, viendo la manera de tener ingresos para su familia, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis wants to keep his business growing. That's why he is has decided on a new loan, so that he can go out and sell spices and serve other areas. He will buy more product, including cumin seeds, achiote, cinnamon, oregano, seeds, and other herbs used in the kitchen.

He states that he has had a positive effect from the previous investment. This is because it allowed him to buy the necessary merchandise, in order to go out and sell to his customers. He is looking at this as a way to have income for his family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cumin seeds, achiote, cinnamon, oregano and seeds.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Pictured here is Alpha, a small scale businessman from the town of Kabala, Northern Sierra Leone. This entrepreneur has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org base in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone to seek for a loan of 5,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to buy more used clothes to add to his current stock. 

Alpha is a native of Makeni city. He is 39 years old and is married to a trader. The couple has three children, two of whom are attending secondary school. Alpha has been a businessman for 17 years. He will use this loan to buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Rom, 33, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been working in the factory for over a year, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband produces palm sugar to sell and earns about USD 4 per day. Since a plot of land in the village next to her house is cheap, Rom is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase the land to construct a house for her children. In the future, she would like to run an additional business that is involved in animal husbandry to generate extra income to support the family and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase land to construct a house for her children

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura lives in Buluk She sells charcoal, and has been in business for five years. She is forty-four years old, married, and has six children; all of them are still in school 

Laura heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan from BRAC She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Progress-Iii Group

texts.en:
Yarie is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in northern Sierra Leone thirty-eight years ago. She is married and has three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. For ten years now, Yarie has been selling palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and gari (food made out of cassava roots). 

This is the first loan that Yarie and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Yarie will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to expand her business. She will buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil and gari in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Allah Thantho Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Allah Thantho” group from Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL)  for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Marie is the leader of this group. The thirty-two-year-old is married to a retired worker and they have three children. Marie has been a businesswoman for six years now. She sells plastic bowls, plates, buckets, spoons, and ready-to-wear-clothes.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale prices to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls, plates, buckets, spoons, and ready-to-wear-clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 35 years old and single with two children. She does farming and has been in the business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of 9,000 KES. 

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs for the farming business.

Her hopes are to grow her business,and start practicing  horticultural farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a married woman. She describes herself as creative, polite and God-fearing. 

She operates a retail business where she sells detergents. She has been involved in this business for six years and employs one staff member. Her business is located within a busy and viable fast-growing town and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as high bus fare costs when transporting the raw materials. 

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy raw materials for detergents. Rahab's dream and  business goal is to own a detergent and oil manufacturing company within five years.

loans.use: to buy raw material for making detergent for selling.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan, 44, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling coconut for over six years, earning approximately, USD 5 per day.
