Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about USD 5 per day. Two of her children are garment workers. They earn about USD 7 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Phan is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Nom

texts.en: Nom, 40, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a cleaner in a provincial hospital for over ten years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband runs a public transportation business (motor taxi). He earns about USD 3 per day. Due the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Nom is requesting a loan of USD 1300 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This purchase would enable her to get to work on time. In the future, she wants her husband to run a Tuk Tuk (a motorcycle based taxi) instead of a motor taxi because it earns more money, and she hopes to help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Maria Maritza

texts.es: María Maritza, tiene la edad  de 56 años, está casada,  vive con sus cinco hijos y el esposo  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar gallinas ponedoras y el concentrado para el mantenimiento de las mismas. El tiene pensado comprar las gallinas pequeñas y mantenerlas hasta su producción y así poder vender los huevos  a un excelente precio al mercado de la localidad, así poder  obtener más ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María Maritza, 56, is married and lives with her husband and 5 children. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy laying hens and the hen feed to maintain them. She will buy chickadees and raise them until production and then sell the eggs at the local market for an excellent price. That way she’ll be able to increase sales in order to improve her quality of life and obtain economic stability. 
This is the 1st loan she receives from FUDECOSUR. She’s never had a loan from a state bank before, but FUDECOSUR offered it to her with less difficulty and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy laying hens.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a 40-year-old widowed woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 18 years to 29 years. She describes herself as an aggressive woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located near a shopping mall and her primary customers are wholesalers. She describes her biggest business challenge as the transportation of cereals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy four bags of maize. Her business goal is to supply cereals to at least 10 supermarkets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she can buy a lorry to aid in transportation of the cereals to her customers.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of maize.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is in the business of running a sari-sari (variety) store. At 52 years of age, half of her life has already been given in manipulating her source of income. It is the main source of providing for the needs of her three children. Now she wants to improve her sari-sari store and build up a new business -- specifically, a hog-fattening business. 

In connection to this, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos to buy groceries, such as canned goods and soft drinks, and two piglets. Hopefully, she can successfully build her new business as well as her current business.

loans.use: to buy groceries, such as canned goods and soft drinks, and two piglets.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon, 29, is married and resides with his wife and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a construction worker for over three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. His wife is a garment worker who earns about USD 3 per day. 

Due to lack of funds, Mon is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase construction materials to build his house. This money will help him finish his house construction and provide better living conditions for his family. 

In the future, he plans to send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build his house

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is 52 years old and a widow with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ludy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ludy has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anye

texts.en:
Anye is married with six children and lives in Ntangang, a quarter in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. The deaths of his son, sister and father-in-law are the main challenges that he has faced in his life and hates thinking about.

This hard working man has taken and repaid loans ten times, and is involved in poultry farming and the cultivation of some basic food crops like maize, beans, groundnuts, yams, and coco yams. His business is located in the Ntangang quarter. He believes his business will succeed, because the animal excrement will be used as manure for the crops and, in turn, some of the harvest from the farm will be used to feed the animals. Demand of food crops is high in his locality, and his neighbors also buy some of his animals for consumption on occasion and for ceremonies such as weddings, funeral celebrations, and cultural rites. The community will also benefit from his animal excrement and yields from the crops which he grows at all times.

He says that the profits from his previous loans were used to buy medication for his family, to educate his children and to assist in the education of his grandchildren. Profit from the requested loan will be used to maintain and expand his compound, and to feed his family. He says that GHAPE loans are preferable, because training is given before loan disbursement, interest rates are very low, repayment is gradual (in installments), and the organization encourages them to save and undertake bigger investments.

loans.use: poultry farming, piggery and cultivation of  maize, beans, groundnut, yams and cocoyam

loans.name: Kim Thai

texts.en: Kim Thai, 36, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than 10 years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed at the rice mill. He earns about USD 10 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Kim Thai is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase cattle for resale. By doing so, she would be able to earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for resale.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 28-year-old married woman living in Al Bayader, Jordan. She is a mother of five children. 

Maha is looking to have a loan of 600 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) so she can paint her house and make it more healthy. 

Maha is under 30 years old so her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to paint her house

loans.name: Mwahanje

texts.en: Mwahanje is a married man. He has 3 children and 1 is enrolled in school. Mwahanje operates a goat business and sells them at the market. He's worked in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are slaughter houses. Mwahanje's other source of income includes farming. He describes his greatest business challenge to be disease outbreaks resulting in the death of animals, and his highest monthly expense is food. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwahanje will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase goats. Mwahanje aspires to expand the business in the future. He joined Yehu because of accessibility to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from four years to eight years old. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a farm where he sells goats and sheep. He has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs two staff members. His business is located in a busy residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of goats and sheep. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more goats and sheep. His business goal is to be a supplier of meat to butchers and shopping malls within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big slaughter house.

loans.use: to buy more goats and sheep.

loans.name: Angel Gerardo

texts.es: El señor Angel tiene 26 años, es soltero, no tiene conviviente y tampoco hijos ni dependientes, termino el colegio y estaba estudiando en la universidad, iba en el tercer año pero no logro terminarlo por falta de recursos económicos, vivió con sus padres, los cuales decidieron quitarle la ayuda económica para que su hijo fuese mas independiente. Actualmente alquilo una pieza junto a su hermana en la zona de Amancayas. El solicitante trabaja en el servicio de transporte urbano, tiene 3 años de experiencia, trabaja de lunes a sábado, su principal gasto es el pago diario al dueño del vehículo por alquileres. El propietario y nuestro cliente se pusieron de acuerdo en asumir los gastos de reparación y mantenimiento del vehículo a 50% cada uno. Para tener mayores ingresos nuestro cliente hace un mes inauguro un ballet de bailes típicos del oriente. El crédito solicitado en la institución es para pagar la instalacion del salon de baile.
texts.en:
Angel, 26, is single; he has no spouse or dependent children.  He completed high school and was attending university.  He was in third year but was unable to finish due to lack of economic resources.  He lived with his parents who decided to stop supporting him so that he would become more independent.

At present, he and his sister have rented a room together in the Amancayas neighborhood.  He works providing urban transportation services; he has three years’  experience.  He works Monday to Saturday and his main expense is the daily vehicle rental fee he pays the vehicle’s owner.  The vehicle’s owner and our client agreed to share vehicle repair and maintenance costs 50% each.

To earn more income, a month ago our client started a traditional eastern dances ballet company.  He’s asking the institution for a loan to pay to set up a dance studio.

loans.use: to set up a dance studio.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita quedo huérfana de padre y madre a muy corta edad, su hermano mayor Juan Carlos se hizo cargo del hogar, sin embargo ella a su corta edad vio necesario colaborar con los gastos de su casa, por lo que muy joven comenzó a trabajar, no pudo estudiar mas que la primaria, y tuvo que idearse algún tipo de negocio. En este sentido es que decide comercializar prendas de vestir, inicialmente de forma ambulante, en las ferias y mercados, pero en algunos lugares las vendedoras que tenían puestos le reclamaban por el tipo de venta que ella realizaba indicándole que tenia que asentarse en algún lugar y como las otras pagar un patente,  es así que haciendo un esfuerzo logra conseguir un puesto de venta, desde el cual actualmente vende sus prendas, ahora vende pantalones de tela y pantalones de jeans para dama, haciendo que su cartera de clientes sea bastante cautiva por la variedad de modelos, y exclusividad que tiene en sus prendas. Tiene una pequeña hija de 7 meses,  vive con el papá de la niña, tiene todo el deseo de formar un hogar definitivo, porque ella no pudo tener ese entorno familiar. Por el momento solo desea concentrarse en su negocio para poder darle un futuro bueno a su niña.EL credito que solicita es para la compra de
texts.en:
Rita became an orphan at an early age when she lost her mother and father.  Her older brother Juan Carlos took charge of the household but, even as young as she was, she saw the need to contribute to the household expenses and began working.  She was not able to study beyond primary school because she had to find work.  She decided to sell clothing as a street vendor at fairs and markets.  But some of the vendors who had stalls selling the same type of merchandise complained that she had to stay put somewhere and pay a fee like the others.  So through much effort she acquired a stall where she sells clothing such as women's trousers and jeans.  She has a good customer base because of the variety and exclusivity of her merchandise.

She has a seven-month-old daughter who lives with the child's father.  She wants to establish a stable home because she was unable to have a family environment.  For now she wants to concentrate on her business and give her daughter a good future.  The loan will be used to buy clothing.

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Pedro Fabian

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro  tiene 57 años de edad es casado, su principal actividad es la de  prestar el servicio de taxista libre es decir busca pasajeros por toda la ciudad de Cochabamba,  Tiene  automóvil propio pero sus papeles de su auto no están a su nombre , trabaja 4 días a la semana, el vive por la Av. Petrolera km 3 en la zona sud,  a 4 kilómetros de la ciudad,  uno de los barrios mas pobres del Cercado, tiene una granja porcina ubicada  rayo pampa- Tarata donde también atiende y abastece de alimento a su granja porcina  . Necesita  de infraestructura para su granja ya que con la lluvia se inundo y el índice de mortalidad de su ganado porcino subió, la granja se encuentra en mal estado las paredes húmedas se vuelven débiles y tienden a caerse y su ganado porcino esta en peligro  a morir aplastados se encuentra muy preocupado el cual es motivo del préstamo que esta tramitando.
texts.en: Pedro is 57 years old and married.  His main business is working as a freelance taxi driver.  He drives all over the city of Cochabamba looking for passengers.  He owns his own vehicle but the car's papers are not in his name.  He works four days a week.  Pedro lives on the km3 stretch of Avenida Petrolera, in the southern zone, four kilometers from the city center, in one of the poorest neighborhoods of El Cercado.  He has a pig farm located in Rayo Pampa, Tarata where he works and supplies his pig farm with feed.  He needs infrastructure for his farm because it became flooded in the rains and the death rate of his pigs increased.  The farm is in a bad state of repair.  The damp walls become weak and tend to collapse which means that his pigs are in danger of being crushed to death.  Pedro is very worried which is why he is taking out this loan.

loans.use: to carry out building work on his pig farm

loans.name: Flamingo Group

texts.en:
Kombo, who is in his late 30s, is married with two children; one of them goes to school and the other one is a baby. He has been selling second-hand clothes and shoes for four years now. He works from 8.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy more clothes and shoes to resell and has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to further increase the second-hand clothes and shoes sold. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Flamingo", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a business woman. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. To earn extra income, she sells second-hand clothes. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income, and she hopes to expand her business in the future. 

She has applied for 40,000 KES to buy a hair blow-dry machine and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow-dry machine and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Channarak

texts.en:
Channarak is 27 years old, married, and has one child.  She lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over four years, earning approximately$4 per day. Her husband is a motorbike mechanic who earns approximately $6 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Channarak is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Met

texts.en: Met, 58, is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for over 20 years, earning approximately 2 USD per day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn approximately 5 USD per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Met is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm to generate extra income to support the family and rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Doreces

texts.en:
Doreces lives in Buluk. She sells fish and has been in business for five years. She is 35 years old, is married, and has five children. All of her children are still in school.
Doreces heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 29 year old, married, and has four children.  All of them are in school.
Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a food vendor.  She cooks  banku for sale.  She serves it with okro and fish stew in Adum Banso near Takoradi.   She has done this for 18 years.  

Georgina is married and has 4 children.  Her husband works at the Benso Oil plantation. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish for the preparing of her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded  business  to build a  better stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: buy  maize and fish to make food to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina  sells maize porridge,  She serves the porridge with bread at Adum-Banso near Takoradi.  She has been selling maize porridge for 2 years now. 

Amina is married to a farmer.  She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her porridge bread for sale. With the new profit, Amina will expand her business.

loans.use: buy maize and flour to make food for sale

loans.name: Ruthsel

texts.en:
Ruthsel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has  4 children. 

Ruthsel has a shop that sells NATASHA & AVON products like clothing & cosmetics. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of NATASHA & AVON products to sell.

Ruthsel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Ruthsel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy NATASHA & AVON products to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Bor. She has a food stall, and has been in business for one year. She is 35 years old, married, and has six children, five of whom are still in school. 

Sarah heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beans for sale.

loans.name: Jamla

texts.en:
Jamla is 32 years old and married. She lives in Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan.
Jamla is looking to have a loan of 1000 JDs so she can expand her trading in home products by buying more quantities. She wishes her project to be bigger and more successful.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell

loans.name: Nyambere Group

texts.fr:
Gisèle fait partie du groupe Nyambere et habite à Gitega. Elle est veuve  de 60 ans. Elle a un enfant de 30ans.

Elle fait du commerce de bananes depuis 20ans.

Elle est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Avec le gain de son commerce, elle achète ce dont elle a besoin : la nourriture, les habits …
Elle est parvenue à s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Gisèle is a member of the Nyambere group and lives in Gitega.  She is a 60-year-old widow and has one child who is 30 years old.
She has been selling bananas for the past 20 years.

This is her 12th loan with Turame.  With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale, in order to make more money.  

Gisèle uses the earnings from her business to purchase what she needs: food, clothes... She was able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 24 years old and divorced. he lives in Al Hashmi, Jordan.

Mohammed want to take a loan of 500 JD so he can purchase more goods for general trading to improve his social and commercial level by increase his income.

Mohammed is under 30 years old so his loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to do general trading

loans.name: Lopezine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes. La représentante du nom de Lopezine est âgée de 24 ans. Lopezine est mariée et a un enfant. Elle a un niveau d'instruction secondaire. Pour supporter ses charges quotidiennes, elle mène comme activité la gestion d'un bar-café depuis huit mois. Dans le but de faire face à une clientèle fidèle et variée de plus en plus croissante, Lopezine sollicite, ensemble avec sa coéquipière un premier crédit auprès de Finadev. La responsable est celle qui se retouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en: This group is made up of two people.  The group's representative, named Lopezine, is 24 years old.  She is married and has one child.  She has attended secondary school.  In order to cover her daily expenses, she has been managing a bar/coffee-shop for the past eight months.  In order to meet the needs of a faithful and diverse group of customers, which is increasing in size, Lopezine is requesting a first loan from Finadev, together with the other member of her group.  Lopezine is the woman shown in the left portion of the photo.

loans.use: to buy six crates of various drinks, one box of milk, 10kg of sugar and one box of spaghetti

loans.name: Adjouavi Elise

texts.fr: Adjouavi Elise est veuve sans enfant. Elle vend des sacs de céréale tels que maïs, mil et autres. Adjouavi Elise s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la place. Ses clientes sont pour la plupart des femmes. Elle veut s'acheter quelques sacs de maïs et mil. Elle ambitionne agrandir son commerce.
texts.en:
Adjouavi Elise is a widow without children. She sells bags of cereal such as maize, millet, etc. She buys her stock at a local market. Most of her customers are women. 

Adjouavi Elise plans to buy a few bags of maize and millet. She will use her savings to provide for her children’s education, and she also plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of maize and 5 bags of millet.

loans.name: Juanitah

texts.en: Juanitah is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for 4 years and describes her business environment as busy because many people do business in that place. To earn extra income she runs a grocery store. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standard and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and hair chemicals

loans.name: Turwanyubunebwe Group

texts.fr:
Léonce fait partie du groupe Turwanyubunebwe, il habite à Gitega. Il a 40 ans et est marié à Sindayiheba cultivatrice .Ensemble, ils ont 4 enfants dont 2 étudient a l’école primaire.

Il est   coiffeur  depuis 17 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il   va  augmenter son capital et acheter des tondeuses supplémentaires.Ainsi, il peut recruter quelqu’un, afin de  servir beaucoup de clients en travaillant conjointement; de ce fait,il va gagner plus.

Avec le gain de son travail, il supporte aisément les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Léonce is part of the Turwanyubunebwe Group and lives in Gitega.  He is 40 years old and is married to a woman named Sindayiheba, who works as a farmer.  Together, they gave four children, two of whom are attending school at the primary level.

He has been a barber for 17 years.

This is his second loan taken out via Turame.  With the loan funded by Kiva, he will augment his capital and purchase additional clippers.  He will be able to recruit someone to work for him so he can better serve his many clients by working in conjunction with someone else.  This way, he will earn higher profits.

With the earnings from his work, he can easily manage his children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to increase his capital, purchase clippers, and hire another person to help him serve his many clients.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 31-year-old, married woman with three children who lives in Kasese,Uganda.She has been in the salon business for 12 years.She started with 1 million UGX and now has 5 million UGX. Her hardships are price fluctuations, high fuel and transport costs, and taxes. 

Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house for residence.Her business goals are to buy land on which to grow crops, move her business to a more permanent location and expand her business into new markets.

Rosemary intends to use the a loan to buy building materials for construction of her residential house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for her house.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, la casa está ubicada en el caserío El Porvenir Hualtaco en el Distrito de Tambogrande. Raquel vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

La actividad que desarrolla Raquel es la agricultura, para lo cual cuenta con 1.0 ha de mango Kent en producción, con plantas de 8 años de edad. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor (ovino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Su esposo es agricultor, quien tiene más área de terreno agrícola (5.0 has), de las cuales 4.0 ha son de mango y el resto entre limón y pan llevar.

Raquel desea mejorar día con día los productos que cosecha, para ello desea comprar fertilizantes para mejorar su cosecha de mango, así como pagar a la mano de obra que va a contratar.  Con los ingresos que perciba Raquel se ayudará para cubrir sus gastos y los de su familia.
texts.en:
Raquel is 57 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives with her family in the farming district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone located in the Piura region over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. 

She makes a living with farming-related work.  She is currently growing lemons, which once harvested she sells to her neighbors and merchants that visit the area.  Raquel is an enterprising and hard-working woman.  These characteristics have allowed her to achieve all she has to date.  The income she earns is invested in her family.  

Raquel wants to buy manure and fertilizers for her farmland, which is why she decided to get a loan of 4000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Doviko

texts.en: Doviko is a forty four year old married man with five children living in Kasese Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been a farmer for the last twenty years. His major hardships are:seasonal weather and price fluctuation, however, he has a goal of diversifying his business to include a retail  shop. Doviko needs a loan to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Magdlene  Tapia

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Magdalene. She is married and has two children aged 26 and 20. She has two neices who are additional dependents. 

In 1984, Magdalene established her building materials business. She began her business just after completing high school when she lost her dad and she didn't have a sponsor to continue her education. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 Leone (SLL) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Magdalene requires a loan in order to buy 60 PVC pipes, each costing 70,000 SLL; the balance is for transportation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 800,000 SLL. In the future, Magdalene is excited for the loan and she is hoping to see her children educated to the university level. She is honest and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy PVC pipe and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina de 32 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 5 y 7 años. Allí tiene una panadería donde  produce panes y postres, que vende  entre la gente del macroproyecto Ciudad Bicentenario, apoyado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  lugar  donde habita.  Ella había iniciado el negocio de tienda panadería, con su cónyuge en otro barrio, pero la ola invernal erosionó  su vivienda y perdieron recursos, así fue como fue reubicada con su familia en este megaproyecto.  Karina y su familia son personas de mucha persistencia, pues antes de emprender su tienda,  habían sido desplazados de su tierra en el departamento de Bolívar, posteriormente cuando estaban trabajando con firmeza, sobrevino la ola invernal , pero ellos no se dejan vencer por las adversidades y por eso en Ciudad bicentenario emprendieron su propia panadería, que aprovechando su anterior experiencia,  quieren darle un esquema de tienda donde adicionalmente vendan ranchos, víveres y artículos de la canasta familiar. Es su negocio el Marido de Karina prepara el pan y los postres y ella muy creativamente sale con su vitrina a la que le puso ruedas,  vendiendo por todo el mega barrio,  donde ahora habita. Ellos tienen muchos sueños de prosperidad, como el de adecuar un local independiente,  para el buen desempeño de su microempresa. Esta es la razón por la cual acuden a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos de consumo que se venden en las tiendas, como víveres, carnes, abarrotes y materias primas en mayor volumen para elaborar nuevos productos de panadería, porque aun cuenta con su  horno, vitrinas cilindradoras y produce  panes y postres, los que reparte  en su vitrina rodante .
texts.en:
Karina, 32, lives in the city of Cartagena with her spouse and two children who are 5 and 7 years old.  She has a bakery there where she produces bread and pastries that she sells among the residents of Ciudad Bicentenario Macroproject which is supported by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and is where she lives.

She had started the bakery business with her spouse in a different neighborhood but the winter surf eroded her house and they lost their resources which is how the family came to be relocated to this mega project.  Karina and her family are very persistent people because before starting her store they had been displaced from their land in Bolívar Department and then when they had succeeded in working steadily the winter surf came.   But they don’t let themselves be defeated by adversity and that’s why they started their own bakery in Ciudad Bicentenario which availing themselves of their prior experience they want to transform  into a store where they will also sell snacks, foodstuffs and basic staple items.

In her business, Karina’s husband prepares the bread and desserts and she very creatively goes out with her display case that she attached wheels to selling throughout the mega neighborhood where she now lives.

They have many dreams of prosperity like setting up a stand-alone locale to better develop their micro business.  This is why they are calling on their Kiva loan, their first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that will be used to buy merchandise sold in stores like foodstuffs, meat, groceries as well as ingredients for bakery items in large volume because she still has her oven, cylindrical display cases and still makes bread and desserts that she sells from her rolling display case.

loans.use: to buy merchandise sold in stores like foodstuffs, meat, groceries as well as ingredients for bakery items in large volume.

loans.name: Roberto De Jesus

texts.es:
Roberto es una persona muy trabajadora que desde hace aproximadamente 17 años viene vendiendo frutas a sus clientes, y con este negocio genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde vive con su esposa y su hijo. Roberto viene trabajando en el sector hace unos 12 años y gracias a este tiempo ha logrado posicionarse en el sector y así captar cada vez más clientes para su negocio, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas y crecer cada vez más generando mayores ingresos para su hogar. Debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital y su negocio requiere algunos mantenimientos, Roberto busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una nueva carreta y nuevas canastillas para ofrecer sus frutas y así hacer su negocio más atractivo para sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio podrá ofrecer una mejor imagen captando más clientes y así aumentando sus ventas considerablemente; con lo que su familia gozará de mejores ingresos optando por tener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Compra de una nueva carreta y nuevas canastillas para ofrecer sus frutas y así hacer su negocio más atractivo para sus clientes.

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
El comité “AMISTAD” está iniciándose en el programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Todas las integrantes del comité se esfuerzan día a día para el bienestar de sus familias, para que estas tengan un futuro mejor y distinto del que a ellas tocó vivir. 
Hermelinda vende ropas, y es por medio de este negocio que ella tiene los medios para poder seguir día a día. Comenta que hay temporadas buenas y malas, pero que pese a ello no se desanima, y que día a día lucha por ser una mejor comerciante y persona. Su meta es seguir adelante y por medio de ese trabajo ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita la ayuda de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya para la compra de ropas, ya que desea poder tener una buena variedad para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Amistad” (Friendship) committee is starting in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women’s program.   All the committee members strive daily for their families’ wellbeing so that they will have futures that are better and different than the ones they got to live.

Hermelinda sells clothes and through this business has the means to continue day to day.  She comments that there are good seasons and bad ones but despite that she does not become discouraged and day to day strives to be a better merchant and a better person.

She asks Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya’s help to buy clothes because she wants to have a good selection available to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Amuor

texts.en:
Amuor lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 35 year old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Amuor heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase onions, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the children’s school fee.

loans.use: to purchase onions, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Achok

texts.en:
Achok lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Achok heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the children’s school fee.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Denis Elena

texts.es:
Denis se encuentra casada y junto con su esposo viven en un apartamento ubicado en la cancha deportiva de su municipio; ellos son los encargados del aseo del lugar, por lo que no tienen que pagar algún arriendo por esto. Desde hace un tiempo decidieron generar ingresos extras con el ánimo de poder gozar de una mejor calidad de vida, y fue así como montaron una venta de dulces, snack y gaseosas. Debido a que su negocio fue montado con muy bajo capital, Denis no puede ofrecer gran variedad de productos a sus clientes, sin embargo, aún así ha podido tener muy buenas ventas, es por esto que ahora que su negocio viene creciendo Denis busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de dulces, snack, y gaseosas para surtir su negocio y un refrigerador donde pueda almacenar las gaseosas.
De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y les seguirá permitiendo tener una buena calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas. Además, Denis sueña con algún día poder tener una gran tienda general ubicada en un lugar más estratégico y comercial y así poder tener mayores ingresos para su futuro.

loans.use: Compra de dulces, snack, y gaseosas para surtir su negocio y un refrigerador donde pueda almacenar las gaseosas.

loans.name: Diego Andres

texts.es:
Diego es una persona muy luchadora que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, ha logrado tener la fortaleza y las ganas de salir adelante para superar las dificultades y continuar progresando en su vida. Hace aproximadamente 5 años decidió montar su propio taller de confección gracias a que desde muy joven aprendió la actividad, pero en ninguna empresa había podido conseguir empleo ya que sufre de epilepsia; de esta manera podría entonces generar sus propios ingresos y poder garantizar una buena calidad de vida. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos su taller de confecciones ha venido creciendo en gran medida, pues en un principio inició trabajando el solo y ha medida que pasa el tiempo viene contratando bastantes operarias para su taller de confección. Debido a que los pedidos por parte de sus clientes siguen creciendo, Diego busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de comprar una máquina cortadora e insumos necesarios para la confección.
De esta manera su taller podrá seguir creciendo y así podrá seguir garantizando un buen empleo para las personas que tiene trabajando en su taller. Además, Diego tiene el sueño de tener un gran negocio y poder empezar a sacar su línea propia, de modo que siga progresando en su vida y superando sus dificultades.

loans.use: Comprar una máquina cortadora e insumos necesarios para la confección.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, pues es desplazada por la violencia de su municipio desde hace cerca de 14 años, y además es madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 4 hijos, pues se separó del padre de sus hijos desde hace un tiempo. A pesar de esto, Fabiola es una persona muy luchadora que ha tenido la fortaleza para trabajar fuertemente por mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y tener mejores condiciones económicas. Desde el momento en que llegó a la ciudad, Fabiola viene ofreciendo la venta de comidas; en un principio lo hacía de manera ambulante en un sector de la ciudad, pero en este sector su negocio no estaba prosperando y se trasladó entonces hacia otro sector de la ciudad donde su negocio si empezó a crecer poco a poco. Posteriormente entidades del Gobierno organizaron el sector donde trabajaba Fabiola y le ofrecieron una choza donde puede ofrecer un mejor servicio de comidas a sus clientes, sin embargo, las mismas entidades le exigen bastantes mejoras por cuestiones de sanidad, por lo que ahora Fabiola busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de 2 mesones de acero inoxidable y así poder cumplir con los requerimientos de las entidades de sanidad.
De esta manera podrá seguir teniendo su negocio y así podrá seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Además, Fabiola sueña con poder algún día tener un gran restaurante y también sueña con brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Compra de 2 mesones de acero inoxidable y así poder cumplir con los requerimientos de las entidades de sanidad.

loans.name: Juana Santa

texts.es: Juana está casada y tiene 45 años. Tiene un hijo de 5 años que asiste a la escuela fiscal. Toda la vida ha vivido en Libertad, nos dice que no podría cambiar su residencia porque le gusta mucho su ciudad. Santiago el esposo de Juana se dedica a la artesanía, así fue como se conocieron ya que ella anteriormente realizaba tejidos con paja toquilla, un producto muy popular en Libertad. Junto a su esposo tomaron la decisión de emprender un negocio ahorrando y prestando dinero. Ahora tiene una tienda que maneja sola desde muy temprano, su esposo se dedica a la venta de ropa. Su inconveniente principal es la temporada invernal por la lluvia. Nos cuenta que como su tienda esta echa de caña se inunda y moja sus productos. Solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, colas etc. productos de primera necesidad. Su meta es construir su local de cemento.
texts.en: Juana is 45 years old and married. She has a 5-year-old son who attends public school. She has lived in Libertad all her life and she tells us that she couldn't change her residence because she likes her town very much. Juana's husband Santiago makes crafts. That's how they met, since she used to weave fabrics using toquilla straw, which is a very popular product in Libertad. Along with her husband she decided to start a business saving and lending money. She currently owns a store, which she manages by herself from the early hours of the morning. Her husband currently sells clothing. Her main inconvenience is wintertime, because of the rain. She tells us that, since her store is made of cane, it floods and wets her merchandise. She requests the loan in order to purchase rice, sugar, olive oil, soft drinks, essential goods, etc. Her goal is to build a store made of cement.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and olive oil.

loans.name: Reina Rafaela

texts.es: Reina es soltera, tiene 41 años y vive Guayaquil. Nació en Manabí pero al casarse se mudo a Guayaquil. Es separada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Cuando se separo de su esposo decidió y con la responsabilidad de criar a sus hijos decidió empezar a vender. Al principio lo realizaba de manera informal pero poco a poco con esfuerzo reunió dinero y  abrió una tienda. Vende gaseosas, recargas telefónicas, cosméticos etc. El negocio lo administra sola empezando desde las 8:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm, cierra un poco tarde porque la no tiene preocupación por la delincuencia. Sus hijos asisten a la escuela fiscal y espera poder apoyarlos hasta la universidad. Con el préstamo incrementara su negocio comprando Jugos, snacks, tarjetas etc. En  5 años ella planea mejorar su vivienda y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Reina is 41 years old and single, and she lives in Guayaquil. She was born in Manabí, but moved to Guayaquil when she got married. She's separated and has two children under her care. When she separated from her husband, she had the responsibility to raise her children, so she decided to start selling. At first she had an informal business, but through her hard work she saved money little by little and opened a store. She sells soft drinks, phone recharges, cosmetics, etc. She manages her business by herself from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. She closes a little late because she doesn't worry about crime. Her children attend public school and she hopes to support them until they go to college. With the loan she will increase her business by purchasing juices, snacks, cards, etc. In five years' time, she plans to improve her home and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cards, soft drinks, juices, snacks.

loans.name: Rosmira

texts.es:
Rosmira es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo ha tenido mucha fortaleza y ganas de salir adelante para superar estas dificultades y continuar progresando en su vida. Rosmira anteriormente trabajaba en su municipio natal en su propio negocio de venta de productos de papelería, pero debido a las pocas oportunidades que existían para seguir progresando decidió mudarse para la cuidad y allí comenzó con mucho esfuerzo un negocio de cafetería. Con este negocio ha venido trabajando fuertemente y ha logrado sacarlo adelante y posicionarlo con sus clientes, y de esta manera puede generar los ingresos que requiere para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde convive con sus 2 hijos, ya que es madre soltera cabeza de familia. Gracias al buen servicio que ofrece en su cafetería Rosmira ha podido crecer considerablemente y esto le ha permitido brindarles a sus 2 hijos el acceso a una buena educación, además de que han tenido la oportunidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Con el ánimo de seguir creciendo, Rosmira quiere ampliar su negocio, por lo que busca que un préstamo le permita ampliar su negocio con un local ubicado al lado de su cafetería.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y manifiesta que así generará un empleo para una persona que lo requiera, permitiéndose mejorarles la calidad de vida a diferentes personas. Rosmira sueña con que su familia pueda seguir progresando y así pueda sacar sus hijos adelante.

loans.use: Ampliar su negocio con un local ubicado al lado de su cafetería.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort  live  at Mbeam near Abura. She  sells secondhand ladies and children's wear. She has been selling secondhand clothes for 3 years now. Comfort is divorced and has 2 children.  As a single parent she uses her income to feed, clothe and pay her children’s school fees. Comfort need this loan to purchase more secondhand ladies and children's wear to sell. With the new profit Comfort plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more secondhand ladies and childrens wear to sell

loans.name: Jelyluz

texts.en:
Jelyluz is 33 years old and is married with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for both children, who are in school. 

Jelyluz runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sardines, noodles, candies, spices, and soft drinks. Jelyluz requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. 

In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and food stuff to sell in her general store

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 55 years old and lives in Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is separated with four children.
Amalia has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 15,000.00 each month from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.
Amalia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Amalia hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante is 34 years old, single and lives in the Philippines.  Renante provides motorela or motorcycle transport services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy tools like an air compressor, T-wrench & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Renante has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Renante hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Josiah Mwangi

texts.en:
Josiah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. He is 48 years old, married to Jane Wanjiru and they have four children.  

Josiah has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy seeds and fertilizers to use in his farm, so as to get a good harvest. He is optimistic that his farm is going to do well in this planting season.

In the future, Josiah hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Belgica Yolanda

texts.es:
BELGICA YOLANDA tiene 47 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con su esposo y el hijo en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.

BELGICA YOLANDA se dedica es ama de casa.
Solicita el crédito para comprar electrodomésticos como cocina, licuadora, refrigeradora, para su hija que ya esta en la universidad.
Con la ayudad del crédito ahora puede realizar las compras que tanto necesitaba.
Las compras las realizará en Quito.
El sueño de ella es que su hija culmine todos sus estudios y obtenga su titulo para verla convertida en una excelente profesional.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es tener una familia en la que siempre prevalezca la felicidad, el amor y sobre todo la unión.
En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer los quehaceres domésticos.

NOTA: LA FOTO ES DE LA CASA QUE DEMUESTRA QUE NO TIENE MUCHA COMODIDAD.
texts.en:
Belgica Yolanda is 47 years old, is married, and has one daughter.  She lives with her husband in the city of Guaranda in Bolívar province.  She spends her time working as a housewife.  

Belgica Yolanda is asking for a loan so she can purchase household appliances such as a stove, a blender, and a refrigerator for her daughter, who is currently at university.   The loan will allow her to buy these items in cash.  She often makes purchases in the city of Quito each year.  

Belgica Yolanda dream is for her daughter to finish her studies and receive her degree so she can become a successful professional.  The main challenge she faces is making sure that happiness, love, and above all, consensus always prevail in her family.  

In Belgica Yolanda's free time she enjoys playing sports and attending special classes.

Note: The photo is of Belgica Yolanda's house, and shows that she lives without much comfort.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances such as a stove, a blender, and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Washington Wilfrido

texts.es:
Washington Wilfrido tiene 41 años de edad vive con su pareja en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 
Washington Wilfrido es operador de mecánica.
Solicita el crédito para realizar la comprar una computadora e impresora. 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la computadora e impresora que tanta falta le hacía.

La compra lo hará en Guaranda. El sueño es ver a mis hijos estudiar y sean profesionales que sigan medicina o sean abogados.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es tener un taller propio.
En el tiempo libre le gusta observar y leer folletos de arte.
texts.en:
Washington Wilfrido is 41 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  He and his family live in the city of Guaranda in Bolívar province.  

Washington Wilfrido works as a mechanical operator.  He is asking for a loan so he can purchase computer equipment.  The loan will allow him to pay cash and not in installments, since the interest is very high.  He often purchases farm products in the city of Guaranda.

Washington Wilfrido’s dream is to see his children study and go on to become professionals, such as doctors or lawyers.  The main challenge he faces is to have his own workshop.

In Washington Wilfrido’s free time he enjoys the art world.

loans.use: to purchase computer equipment.

loans.name: Duo Santa Ana Group

texts.es: Duo Santa Ana. la señora Maria Ofelia de 36 años de edad ella se separo de su esposo y por esa Razón lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos,y darles lo necesario mientras ban creciendo,ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones en la comunidad donde ella vive y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elavoracion de refacciones ya que gracias a Dios sus Ventas aumentan dia a dia espera que fape y kiva le puedan apoyar en su negocio

loans.use: Compra de productos comestibles para la elavoracion de refacciones para la venta.

loans.name: Gs Vero Group

texts.es:
La Señora Verónica, es  casada, es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de golosinas como nacatamales, tutti fruti, mariscos y también venta de ropa nueva y achinería  ella cuenta con 12 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio.
Doña Verónica cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en la venta de Golosinas y de sus demás productos, ella cuenta con  la clientela de la zona de las montañas y cafetaleras de jamastran, ella a través de su negocio a salido adelante, ya que ha sido una de las principales fuentes de ingresos, ella se a sabido ganar la clientela porque su  manera de atenderlos es muy especial. Doña Verónica el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de mariscos, frutas, maíz, utensilios de cocina y compra de ropa nueva para la venta.
Doña Verónica el crédito solicitado le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Los Sueños y planes a futuro de Doña Verónica son que su negocio crezca y se fortalezca para dar el sustento a su familia.
La Señora María se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de chorizo en masa, embutidos de cerdo, embutido de res, y  molida de maíz.
La Señora Oneyda, se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de  nacatamales y ropa nueva.  
 
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Verónica is married and is a very hard-working person. She works in sales. Her main activity is selling foods such as pork tamales, fruit salad, and seafood. She also sells new clothing and low-cost consumer goods. She has twelve years of experience managing her business.
Verónica counts on her husband's support in selling her food and the rest of her products. Her customer base is in the mountain and coffee-growing areas of Jamastran. Her business has allowed her to get ahead, since it has been one of her main sources of income. She has been successful in gaining customers because her customer service is very special. 
Verónica will use the loan to purchase seafood, fruit, corn, and kitchen utensils, and to purchase new clothing to sell. The granted loan will help Verónica have a better business, so that she can cover home expenses and give her family a better quality of life.
Verónica's dreams and plans for the future are that her business will grow and become stronger so that she can support her family.
María works in sales. Her main activity is selling chorizo paste, pork sausage, beef sausage, and ground corn.
Oneyda works in sales and her main activity is selling pork tamales and new clothing.   
 
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase seafood, fruit, corn, and kitchen utensils, and to purchase new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Duo Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Duo Vista Hermosa. la señora delfina casada y tiene 2 hijos ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y ademas de eso tiene una tienda donde vende productos comestibles de primera necesidad ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa para la venta y compra de productos comestibles para su tienda nos cuenta que nececita surtir mas su tienda ya que sus clientes le piden productos que abese ella no tiene, espera que kiva le pueda ayudar con el credito solicitado.

loans.use: Compra de ropa nueva para la venta y compra de productos comestibles para tienda.

loans.name: Gs La Cumbre Ii Group

texts.es:
La joven Kenia tiene 23 años,  es una persona  muy responsable y  luchadora, ella vive con su hija, su esposo y  su madre quienes la respaldan en cada uno de sus compromisos.
Kenia se dedica a la venta de pinol, ella tiene su negocio de manera ambulante ya que viene trabajando con personas desde hace 8 años.  el crédito lo necesita para la compra de maíz, cacao, canela, leña etc. para así de esta manea satisfacer, los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes todas las semanas ya que por la calidad de sus producto tiene mucha demanda.
el impacto que tendrá con el crédito Kenia es que podrá comprar más producto e incrementar sus venta, y de esta manera generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
los planes a futuro de Kenia es hacer crecer su negocio, y darle una buena educación a su hija.
Mirna se dedica a la venta en su Pulpería
Evelsa vende leña y tortillas para el sustento de ella y su familia.

Choluteca, Honduras – Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Kenia, 23, is a very responsible young woman and a fighter.  She lives with her daughter, her husband, and her mother, who support her in every one of her commitments.  Kenia sells "pinol" [a corn/cocoa-based powder to make drinks].  She does her business as a street vendor and has been working with people for eight years.

She needs the loan to buy corn, cacao, cinnamon, firewood, etc., so she can satisfy the orders she gets every week from her customers.  Her product is in great demand because of the quality.

The impact of the loan is that Kenia will be able to buy more products and increase her sales.  In this way she will generate better income for herself and have a better quality of life.  Kenia's future plans are for her business to grow and to give her daughter a good education.

Mirna works in sales in her grocery store and Evelsa sells firewood and tortillas to support herself and her family.

Choluteca, Honduras, March 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, cacao, cinnamon, firewood, and other products.

loans.name: Duo Damas Laboriosas Group

texts.es: Duo Damas Laboriosas. Doña Vilma como la Conocen en la comunidad donde Vive, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa americana y vennta de calzado de segunda mano, ella no pierde tiempo siempre esta ofreciendo su productos en cada reunion que tiene eso la a syudado a darle buelta al poco capital que tiene y por esa razon esta solicitando este credito ya que el poco capital que tiene no le alcanza, desde ya agradese a Fape y kiva por la ayuda que le puedan brindar.

loans.use: Compra de ropa y calzado de segunda mano

loans.name: Duo El Manzanillo Group

texts.es: Duo el Manzanillo.don Lorenzo de 54 años de edad el se dedica a la venta de verduras y a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad desde hace varios años mos comenta que conocer esta intitucion es un regalo de Dios por el apoyo que le puedan dar, el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de verduras y compra de productos comestibles y asi de esa manera seguir con su negocio y desde ya agradese la ayuda brindada.

loans.use: Compra de verduras y productos comestibles.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, 30, is married, resides with her husband and one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for over five years and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Additionally, she runs a groceries store at home to generate more income to support the family.  She earns approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband is employed in a gas station. He earns about USD 5 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Mom is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to sell. This purchase would enable her to earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the additional profit to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Samet

texts.en:
Samet, 27, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over six years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s economic situation, Samet is requesting a loan of USD 700 to raise capital for her business to purchase more groceries to resell. This purchase would enable her to generate more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to purchase timber to cover her house’s walls and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 47 years old, married, and has four children.

Mona has been a tailor since 2005. She professionally makes, repairs, or alters clothing such as suits, coats, and dresses for women. She has more than ten years of experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to rent a shop. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to rent a shop.

loans.name: Kasangaki

texts.en: Kasangaki is a hardworking married man with two children living in Hoima, Uganda. He trades in produce and fish, which he has been doing for four years. He faces the challenges of seasonal weather variations and high price fluctuations.His personal goal is to educate his children and his business goal is to diversify his business into to include fish processing. Kasangaki intends to use the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 40-year-old hardworking lady with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent house.

She has been a retailer for the last three years after using her salary savings as capital, and she has continued to grow her business. She is facing hardships of price fluctuations and inflation. However, she has dreams of buying land to grow crops, expanding her business to new areas and moving her business to a permanent location.

Joy needs a loan to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ayuen

texts.en:
Ayuen lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 year, marriage, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Ayuen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase beans,rice for sale.

loans.name: Aruar

texts.en:
Aruar lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, marriage, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Aruar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Aman

texts.en:
Aman lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 38 year, marriage, and has six children; four of them are still in school. 

Aman heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 28 year, marriage, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, soda. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase beans, soda for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter  is a 49-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 18 years to 30 years. He describes himself to be an honest and social man. 

Peter operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a densely populated area  and his primary customers are butcher shopkeepers.  In addition, he sells coffee, milk and bananas in order to increase his income. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving his business. He will use KES 20,000 to buy a bull and a sheep and KES 10,000 for meat. His business goal is to buy his own cows for milking within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he can purchase a plot of land and build rental houses .

loans.use: to buy a bull and a sheep worth Kes 10,000 each.

loans.name: Duo Perlas Cristalinas Group

texts.es: Duo perlas Cristalinas. Mayra de 31 años de edad es casada y tiene un hijo ella se dedica a vender granizadas frente a una escuela desde hace varios años tambien tiene una tienda de productos de consumo diario nos cuenta que con el credito anterior pudo durtir mas su negocio es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos para elavorar granizadas y compra de productos comestibles para su tienda.

loans.use: Compra de productos comestibles y productos para elavorar granizadas.

loans.name: Duo Vista Hermosa De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Vista Hermosa La señora Vicenta, Despuès de haber tenido su bebè  le agradece mucho a Dios por recupera fuerzas para continuar su rutina de vendedora ambulante ya que por su situación no lo hacia como tenia que hacerlo.  Sus clientes la buscan y llaman para hacerle pedido de blusas ya que tiene un gran carisma para vender, y es muy amable y respetuosa. esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para vender ya que este negocio le a permitido ayudar mucho a sus hijos ella tienen grandes sueños y metas por lograr, y seguirán negociando para ofrecerle lo mejor a sus hijos que son lo mas importante para ella.

loans.use: Compra de ropa nueva para la venta

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

texts.es:
DUO GUADALUPE
Tiburcia    de 49 años  que se dedica a la venta de frutas  y helados  donde ella vive  desde hace 17 años  ella necesita otro crédito para invertir para este tiempo de Semana Santa  es donde aprovecha a generar más ingresos y poder salir a vender helados  en la aldea con la ayuda de su esposo, su deseo es poder agrandar su negocio y tener variedad de frutas  para que su clientela no suba al pueblo a comprar  y así  mismo poder ser un apoyo económico en su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia, solicitan este credito para la compra de frutas y productos para elavorar elados para la venta.

loans.use: Compra de frutas y productos para elavorar elados para la venta.

loans.name: Santos Emilio

texts.es: Don Emilio tiene 59 años de edad, es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tiene 11 hijos, de los cuales 4 dependen de el y el resto de sus hijos se dedica a la agricultura, el y su familia residen en la  comunidad de las cañitas, departamento de Olancho. Desde hace 38 años don Emilio se dedica al cultivo de café, maíz y frijoles, actualmente sigue con el negocio y trabaja con sus hijos en la finca de café, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am hasta las 2:00 pm, cuando es temporada de cosecha trabaja durante todo el día ya que el trabajo es abundante. Una de las ventajas que tiene  es que obtiene buenos ingresos del cultivo de café y la desventaja es que en algunas ocasiones el café se le daña por la plaga y la falta de fertilizantes. Don Emilio esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes. Cabe mencionar que con las ganancias obtenidas del prestamo anterior le permitio realizar algunas mejoras  a su vivienda. La  meta de don Emilio es hacer crecer su finca, para así aumentar sus ganancias y mejorar la economía de su hogar. Este es su segundo préstamo en FAMA y ha cumplido puntualmente con el compromiso de sus pagos.
texts.en: Don Emilio is 59 years old. He is married. His wife is a homemaker and they have 11 children, of which 4 are dependent on him. The rest of the children are farmers. He and his family live in the Las Cañitas community in the department of Olancho. For 38 years, Emilio has grown coffee, corn, and beans. Currently he is continuing with the business, and he works with his children on the coffee farm. His work schedule is from 6:00 am until 2:00 pm. During harvest season he works all day, since there is plenty of work. One of the advantages he has is that he obtains good profits from growing coffee. The disadvantage is that sometimes the coffee is damaged by pests and lack of fertilizers. Emilio is asking for the loan in order to buy manure and fertilizers. He will also use the profits from his business to buy wood and improve his house, since he was able to get good earnings from selling the coffee. Emilio's goal is to make his farm grow in order to increase his earnings and improve the finances of his household. This is his second loan with FAMA, and he has been punctual with his loan repayments.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
Doña Catalina como es llamada por sus amigos y vecinos, esta casada, tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su propia casa de habitación en el departamento de Valle en el sur de Honduras. El negocio de Doña Catalina es un Hotel y Comedor, en donde ofrece servicio de habitación y venta de desayunos, almuerzos, cenas, pescado frito, camarones, curiles, refrescos y golosinas.
Doña Catalina tiene su negocio ubicado en la  zona sur de Honduras. Esta solicitando la cantidad de 10,000.00 lempiras para la compra de refrescos, verduras, carnes, mariscos, agua y otros productos, y de esta manera generar mayores ventas en su negocio, por lo que sus ingresos serán mejores.
Entre sus sueños a futuro de Doña Catalina esta la idea de expandir mas su negoció con estos ella y su familia tendrán una mejor vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Catalina, 55, is married and lives with her husband and son in their own home, which is in the Department of Valle in Southern Honduras. Catalina's business is a Hotel with Dining Services, where she offers room service and sells breakfast, lunch, dinner, fried fish, shrimp, mollusks, drinks, and sweets. 

Catalina's business is in the southern region of Honduras. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 lempira to buy drinks, vegetables, meat, seafood, water, and other products. This way, she can increase sales at her business and gain more revenue. Among Catalina's dreams for the future is the idea of expanding her business further, and with this her family will have a better life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy drinks, vegetables, meat, seafood, water, and other products for her business

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech, fifty, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs a business buying fish to re-sell. He earns about USD 5 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Pech is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the money she saves on transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino is single. He is 42 years old and lives in Mantic, Tangub City.

Rufino operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years and every month he earns PHP 3,000 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,758 to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

Rufino has been a member of GDMPC for a year. He saves as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old with 3 children. She lives in Hioma,Uganda. Susan owns a depot where she sells beer and soda (soft drinks). She started her business with capital of one million shillings and now has worth of five million shillings. She wishes to diversify her business and expand to new markets. 

Susan faces the challenges of high price fluctuations and high fuel costs. She intends to use the loan to beers and sodas for sell. 

Susan's personal goal is to educate her children and build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Mahfooz

texts.en:
Mahfooz is a 24-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He describes himself as intelligent and an honest man.  His educational background is a diploma.

He operates a rehabilitation and training center that is primarily educational but also commercial. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs four staff members. His customers are students who have graduated from secondary school. He works diligently to teach his students computer skills and English.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. So he applied for a youth loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy computers for his business.

In the future, he would like to expand his business to open an institute of health.

loans.use: to buy computers for his training center.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Maricel has a pigpen where she sells grown pigs. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy pig feed, such as Purina, Pigrolac and Unifeeds.
Maricel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds.

loans.name: Kolab

texts.en: Kolab, 46, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store for more than four years, earning approximately USD 7 per day. Her husband is a carpenter who earns about USD 4 per day. One of her children is a tourist guide who earns about USD 12 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Kolab is requesting a loan of USD 1400 to purchase more groceries for resale. This money will allow her to expand her grocery store and earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for resale

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is 41 years old and married with two children. He sells bananas to earn a living. He has been in the business for 18 years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Ivan Dario

texts.es:
Ivan siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador, y esto le ha permitido superar grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida. Ivan se encuentra casado y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, a quien siempre busca brindarle una buena calidad de vida y buenas oportunidades de estudio. Desde muy temprana edad aprendió las actividades de la agricultura, gracias a que sus padres se dedicaban a esta actividad y desde muy joven se la enseñaron para que trabajara junto a ellos; y es con la experiencia que ha adquirido que ahora tiene un cultivo de verduras el cual es reconocido por la buena calidad de los productos que allí se cosechan. Con su negocio, Ivan genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, y es por esto que siempre trabaja fuertemente en este con el ánimo de hacerlo crecer y cada vez aumentar sus ventas. Actualmente presenta una gran dificultad que es la temporada invernal que le ha venido deteriorando el crecimiento de sus cosechas, y es por esto que ahora busca que un préstamo le permita comprar impermeabilizantes, abonos, riegos e insecticidas para poder sacar su cosecha adelante a pesar del fuerte invierno.
De esta manera podrá seguir ofreciendo productos de buena calidad a sus clientes y así podrá seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar.
