Además, Ivan espera que su familia siga progresando económicamente y en un futuro puedan tener una mejor estabilidad económica que les permita progresar.
texts.en:
Ivan has always been known as a hard worker. This has enabled him to overcome great adversities in his life. Ivan is married and has a four-year-old son, so he is always looking to provide them a good quality of life and good opportunities for study. His parents taught him farming activities at a very early age. As a young man, he utilized what he learned and began working with his parents. With the experience he gained, he now has a crop of vegetables and is known for harvesting good quality products. This business enables Ivan to generate the income he needs to maintain the household expenses, which explains why he works hard and is eager to grow and increase his sales.

His greatest difficulty at the moment is the winter season, which has diminished the growth of his crops. Now he is seeking a loan so that he can buy waterproofing material, compost, insecticides, as well as pay for irrigation so that his crops can thrive during the strong winter. This will help him continue offering good-quality products to his customers and generating the income he needs to maintain the household expenses. In addition, Ivan hopes that his family will continue progressing financially and have better economic stability so that they can move forward.

loans.use: to buy waterproofing material, compost, insecticides, as well as pay for irrigation.

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Jariatu. She is married and has three children aged 16, 11 and 9. She has two additional dependents, her brother's children, who came to live with her for assistance in their schooling. 

In 2002, Jariatu established her fast food, soft and hard drinks business. She began her business because she stopped at form 4 and later took a catering course. After graduation she worked for some time and established a restaurant. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,950,000 Leone (SLL) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Jariatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy: 11 crates of stout at 89,000 SLL, 10 crates of Carlsberg Beer at 120,000 SLL, 15 crates of assorted soft drinks at 37,000 SLL, and 7 crates of Maltina beer at 37,000 SLL. The balance of 7,000 SLL will be used to pay laborer. 

In the future, Jariatu plans to acquire a shop, buy a car, build a house and travel abroad. This loan will help to improve her business. The shortage of drinks during holidays is her challenge. She is a hardworking business woman. She is very glad about the loan which has improved her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy: 11 crates of stout at 89,000 SLL, 10 crates of Carlsberg Beer at 120,000 SLL, 15 crates of assorted soft drinks at 37,000 SLL, and 7 crates of Maltina beer at 37,000 SLL. The balance of 7,000 SLL will be used to pay laborer.

loans.name: Aminata Issa

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Aminata Issa.  She is married and has two children aged 18 and 15 years. In 1992, Aminata Issa established her business selling body lotion, earrings, toothpaste, polos, soap, roll-on, bed covers, and spray, etc. She began her business because she used to assist her mother after school hours to sell in the market.  After she dropped out of school and got married, her husband gave her some amount to start the business.  
 
Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Aminata Issa has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bathing soap - 15 dozen @ Le 24,000, polos - 10 dozen @ Le 113,000, bed covers - 10 dozen @ Le 198,000 and toothpaste - 22 dozen @ Le 24,000. Balance Le2,000 for labourer to lift the goods bought.

In the future, Aminata Issa plans to become an international business woman.  These loans will help her to expand her business.  Her major challenge is competition.  She is a serious and hardworking businesswoman.  She will continue to take loans at ARD until she accomplishes her future plans.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bathing soap - 15 dozen @ Le 24,000, polos - 10 dozen @ Le 113,000, bed covers - 10 dozen @ Le 198,000 and toothpaste - 22 dozen @ Le 24,000. Balance Le2,000 for labourer to lift the goods bought.

loans.name: Toeurm

texts.en:
Toeurm, 29, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband runs a delivery service. He earns about USD 5 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Toeurm is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house and help her children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Menunatu. She is married and has two children who are 10 and 6 years old. In 2002, Menunatu established her plastic slippers, baby items, head ties and cosmetics business. She began her business because she was not educated to be employed in an office. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 950,000 every month from this business as profit. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Menunatu requires a loan to buy more plastic slippers, baby items, head ties and cosmetics. In the future, Memunatu plans to build a house and to give her children a quality education.  She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic slippers, baby items, head ties and cosmetics

loans.name: Ndosho Group

texts.fr: La cliente Vumilia, membre du groupe de crédit Ndosho, Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 40 ans. Elle fait les transactions frontalières de vente de tabac (en l’état brut) de la RDC vers le pays voisin (Rwanda). Son mari est sans emploi. Il y a  15 ans qu’elle  fait le petit commerce frontalier. Elle bénéficie régulièrement des crédits  de Hekima pour renforcer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  9eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  d’acheter 2 colis de tabac soit 500 kg.  En dépit de tout, cette affaire de tabac est chèrement soumise aux taxes. En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une parcelle dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
Vumilia, age 40, is a member of the group Femme Dynamique (Dynamic Woman). She is an entrepreneur who has been engaged in border trading of raw tobacco from the DRC to Rwanda for 15 years. Her husband is currently unemployed. She often seeks financial assistance from Hekima to strengthen her activities. Her profits help to boost her savings, and to pay for food and for her children’s tuition. 

With her business showing growth throughout the last cycle, she has applied for her 9th loan and opted to seek a larger amount than usual. She will use this new loan to purchase two packs of tobacco totaling 500 kg. However, this tobacco trade is subject to heavy taxes. 

She wants to see her children grow up, and hopes someday to buy a plot of land. She wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping low-income women to become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to purchase two packs of tobacco totaling 500 kg for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila has been an aspiring entrepreneur for her entire life. 

After some unfavorable circumstance in the department where she was a teacher, Sheila was forced out of her job. She did not see this as a curse though. This allowed her to pursue her own business. 

Sheila founded Paper Doll Boutique and Beauty Bar in 2007 as a clothing store and website where customers could come to buy contemporary, vintage, and street wear clothing for a competitive rate. In the store she also provides personal shopping assistance and styling services. 

She has many goals for this store but none is greater than to expand and help employ members of her community. She especially would like to help employ the youth of her community. She already has one employee and also gets help from her daughter, but she would like to expand further. 

This loan would help her provide the capital that she will need to improve her store and store front to attract more clientele and grow her business.

loans.use: To improve the look of her store front and to improve the general organization of her store.

loans.name: Everth Antonio

texts.es: Everth Antonio inicio su negocio desde hace quince años con esfuerzo propio como es la compra y venta de ganado lo hace de forma ambulante, cuenta con mucha experiencia ya que la adquirió de su papa el cual se dedicaba a la misma actividad económica ,actividad que en la actualidad le ha sido muy rentable gracias al apoyo que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado con los financiamientos le han servido para cumplir sus sueños como es invertir más en la compra de animales vaca, vaquillas, para darle un mejor servicio a la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Everth Antonio started his business 15 years ago through his own efforts.  He buys and sells cattle as a traveling merchant.  He acquired a great deal of experience working with his father, who was in the same trade.  At the moment his business is very profitable thanks to the support of Fundación León 2000, which has provided loans to help him fulfill his dreams.  

His loan will be invested in the purchase of animals, such as cows and heifers, so that he can provide better service and meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase cows and heifers to sell.

loans.name: Amor De Mujeres Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Amor De Mujeres esta por quince integrantes en el cual cada uno tiene su propio negocio y se dedica  a diferente actividades, este grupo de emprendedores, ya han trabajado con fundación león 2000 en varios ciclos durante el crédito han mostrado ser responsable y con deseos de superación sus mayores sueños es de crecer en sus negocios y cumplir sus metas propuestas. Reyna Rafaela es parte de este grupo de emprendedores y su actividad a la que se dedica es a una pulpería que la tiene ubicad en su casa de habitación, está solicitando  nuevamente financiamiento nuevamente para comprar granos básicos, aceite, verduras, jabón, detergente, pan, entre otros productos que mas solicitan.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Amor de Mujeres" (Love of Women) consists of 15 members.  All of them have their own businesses in various activities.  This group of entrepreneurs has worked with Fundación León 2000 in several loan cycles and has demonstrated that they are responsible and have the drive to succeed.  Their greatest dreams are to grow their businesses and to fulfill the goals they have set for themselves.  

Reyna Rafaela is a part of this group of entrepreneurs.  She manages a store located in her home.  The new loan she is requesting will be used to purchase basic grains, oil, vegetables, soap, detergents, bread, and other products that are frequently requested.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, oil, vegetables, soap, detergent, bread, and other products.

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Korn, age 45, resides with her husband and four children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is involved in breeding pigs. He earns about $4 per day. Three of their children are employed as drivers and construction workers. They earn $20 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Korn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase piglets to breed in order to sell them when they gain weight. In doing so, she will earn more profit to support the family. 

In the future, Korn would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed in order to sell them when they gain weight.

loans.name: Adekye Nsroma Group

texts.en:
Justina is a 43-year-old woman. She is married with 2 children. Kate is a very supportive person. She sells clothing materials and clothes. She has been in this trade for the past 18 years. She treks to Accra in the southern part of Ghana to purchase her stock. Because of the lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick up enough stock to make enough profit to support her family. 
With the loan, she wants to purchase more stock of materials and clothes to enable her to increase her sales. She believes the loan will enable her to save more income to support her children’s education. She is a member of the group called Adekye Nsroma, which means morning star. The members agree to be guarantors for each other as a means of collateral.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of materials and clothes

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en: Mary is a 32-year-old married woman. She has four children between 2 and 14 years old. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a retail store and a chemist where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located along a busy matatu route and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of clothes. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to import clothes and supply them to retailers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mirtha Elena

texts.es:
Mirtha es una mujer de 43 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, con 01 hijo menor a su cargo. Vive  en casa  propia  con su familia. La casa está ubicada en el Caserío Pueblo Libre  del distrito de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio de luz.
La actividad que desarrolla MIrtha es la crianza de animales menores (ovinos, caprinos porcinos y aves de corral)los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.  Su esposo es comerciante de fruta, radica en la ciudad de Lima, en el mercado mayorista recibe la fruta de parte de su esposa y él la comercializa allá, para lo cual le envía quincenalmente dinero para la compra de fruta.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 4500 nuevos soles, los cuales se emplearán para invertir en el mejoramiento de la infraestructura (paredes, techo, puertas) de su vivienda,  esto le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a 43-year-old woman who lives with her husband and her one dependent child.  She lives in her own house with her spouse and children.  The house is located in the rural part of Pueblo Libre village, in the Tambogrande district and has electricity.  The place is a community of about 90 families.

Mirtha works breeding small animals (sheep, goats, pigs, and poultry), which she sells in the local market.  She has worked at this for about 10 years, thus she knows the system perfectly.  Her husband is a fruit seller in a wholesale market in Lima.  She sells him money to buy the fruit and he helps pay the family expenses.

The loan amount she is requesting is 4500 nuevos soles which she will use to invest in improvements to her home which will allow her to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase walls, a roof, and doors for her home

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Don José tiene 58 años de edad, el vive con su  familia, tiene 4 hijo, Su actividad principal es la venta de lubricantes y repuestos, desde hace más de 15 años,  Don José, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: neumáticos, parches, líquidos de frenos, aceites y otros para la buena atención de sus clientes, el realiza sus ventas en un local junto a su casa de habitación , el es una persona muy trabajadora, ya que su negocio a sido la principal fuente ingresos, y se ha ganado la clientela por su buena manera de atenderlos, con el préstamo que reciba Don José, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Los sueños de Don José es tener una parchadora de neumáticos automática y surtir mas su local 
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras Abril 2012
texts.en:
José, 58, lives with his family and has four children.  His main job for more than 15 years has been selling lubricants and spare parts.

José is requesting the loan to buy such products as tires, patches, brake fluid, motor oil, and other things for good customer service.

He makes his sales in a space next to his home.  He is a very hardworking person because his business has been his main source of income and he has gained customers for his good service.  The loan will help José to have a better business and get better income to cover the household expenses and give his family a better quality of life.

José's dreams are to have an automatic tire patcher and to supply his store more.

Danli, El Paraíso, Honduras, April 2012

loans.use: to buy tires, patches, brake fluid, motor oil, and other products.

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander Antonio, el trabaja como profesor de uno de los colegios de la comunidad donde habita, este emprendedor tiene una vivienda en el cual le quiere realizar algunas mejoras pero por falta de dinero no las había podido hacer. Gracia al financiamiento que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado es que  ha podido realizar sus sueños como es la mejora de su casa para el bienestar de su familia con el financiamiento comprara material de construcción como: ladrillos, tejas, madera, cemento entre otros materiales.
texts.en:
Alexander Antonio is 23 years old.  He works as a teacher at one of the high schools in the community where he lives.  He already has years of experience as a teacher.  

This enterprising young man has a house on which he wants to do some repairs, but because of a lack of money, he has not done them.  He needs to finish them because the rainy season is coming and its urgent that he do the repairs.  

Alexander Antonio is asking for this loan to purchase bricks, tiles, wood, cement, and other construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, tiles, wood, cement, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Olimpia Marisol

texts.es: Marisol es una mujer divorciada vive con sus dos hijos en Esmeraldas, Ecuador. En Quinindé, un cantón donde el clima es seco y caliente, la antigüedad del cantón permite a las personas descansar durante los viajes por ser un lugar preciso sobre la carretera que conecta a las provincias de Quito y Santo Domingo. En este lugar la agricultura y la ganadería se destacan como las principales actividades que realizan sus habitantes, Marisol tiene desde hace 8 años una carnicería en este cantón para poder atender a sus hijos que van a la escuela y hacer crecer la economía familiar. Ella trabaja 8 hora diarias para poder mantener el negocio, a lo largo de los años se ha enfrentado con muchas dificultades económicas que la han hecho pasar malos momentos, sin embargo han podido salir adelante en familia. Uno de sus anhelos más grandes como madre y como mujer es poder apoyar a sus hijos con este negocio y hacerlo crecer para demostrarles que es posible salir adelante y conseguir sus sueños a pesar de las dificultades, que con mucha energía disposición las metas se pueden lograr. Le brindamos nuestro apoyo a Marisol para que pueda hacer crecer su negocio y lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Marisol is a divorced woman living with her two children in Esmeraldas, Ecuador.  In Quinindé, a canton with dry, hot climate, the antiquity of the canton permits people to rest during trips because it’s a beautiful place alongside the highway connecting the provinces of Quito and Santo Domingo.  In this place agriculture and animal husbandry stand out as the main activities residents carry out.

Marisol has had a butcher shop for 8 years in this canton to take care of her children who attend school and to make the family’s economy grow.  She works 8 hours daily to be able to stay in business.  Along these years she’s faced many economic difficulties that caused her to go through some bad moments.  However, she’s managed to get ahead as a family.  

One of her greatest wishes as a mother and as a woman is to be able to help her children by means of this business and to make it grow to show them that it’s possible to get ahead and reach your dreams despite difficulties; that with much energy and willingness goals can be met.

We give Marisol our support so that she can make her business grow and she can reach her goals.

loans.use: to invest in her butcher shop.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 38-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 20 years. She describes herself as an honest, God-fearing, and obedient woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits such as peas and avocados. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is at a strategic location. She is facing a business challenge of a shortage of fruits for resale.

Hellen will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fruit from farmers. Her business goal is to be a fruit supplier within 5 years. In the future, she hopes to build her own house, buy herself a new car, and create job opportunities in her business using the ancticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy fruit from farmers.

loans.name: Katty Elizabeth

texts.es:
KATTY ELIZABETH tiene 33 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos en Montalvo provincia de los Ríos.

KATTY ELIZABETH es empleada Privada trabaja en una escuela. Solicita el crédito para poder comprar un terreno. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el terreno poder construir una casita.

La compra la efectuará en Babahoyo. El sueño e spoder tener casa propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es el mal clima.

En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Katty Elizabeth is 33, married and has two children. She lives with her kids and husband in Montalvo in the province of Los Rios. She works at a school.

She would like a loan to be able to buy a piece of land. With the help of the loan she will buy land to construct a small house. She will buy land in Babahoyo. Her dream is to own a home. One challenge she might face is bad weather.

In her free time she likes to rest.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Juán Rafael

texts.es: Juan Rafael, tiene la edad  de 54 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su señora que es su mayor prioridad. Él con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, almácigo y pagar mano de obra para la siembra y asistencia de café, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia en el manejo de café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Rafael, 54, is single.  He lives with his wife, who is is biggest priority.

With his loan he plans to buy fertilizer and seedbeds, and pay for labor for the planting and attention to the coffee.  In this way he will be assured of doing a good job.

What he hopes for is to make the most of the good climate and soil conditions for this crop, and also put into practice his experience in the management of coffee.  Also, he hopes to be able to buy the best products of the best quality so his plantation will have good development and health, and to have a suitable production in the short term.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  Previously he had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant coffee.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 63 years old and lives in Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. 

Epifania has a general store that sells a variety of products, such as oil, bread, and matches. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 49,900 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Epifania has been a member of PMPC for twelve years. In the future, she hopes that her cocoland will be back of his own for the additional income someday.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Sophein

texts.en: Sophein, 37, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been renting discs and selling groceries for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 8 per day. In order to improve her family’s living condition, Sophein is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to raise capital in her business for purchasing more groceries to resell. By doing so, she would be able to earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business for purchasing more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran, 23, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops and rubber cultivation for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 15 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Saran is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase fertilizer to use in rubber cultivation. This money will help her plants grow well and provide a high yield of rubber. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to use in rubber cultivation.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 42-year-old married woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a mother of six children.

Taghreed is selling clothes from her house, and she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more quantities for business purposes.

Taghreed is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Donya

texts.en:
Donya is a conservative woman so she is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her mother.

Donya is 20 years old and a married woman, a mother of one child. She lives in Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Donya is looking to have a loan of 800 JDs so she can buy more makeup, clothes, perfumes and cosmetcs in order to expand her general trading.

Donya is under 30 years old so her loan is considered as a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, clothes and makeup for trading

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is a hairdresser. She owns a beauty salon in Adum Banso. Dora has completed J.H.S. She is married. Her husband is a driver. Dora has been a hairdresser for eight years now. Her loan will be used to purchase hair creams, hair extensions and wigs for her beauty salon. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams, hair extensions and wigs for her beauty salon

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Inés es una mujer trabajadora muy responsable que cuenta con la edad de 43 años, la cual vive en unión Libre, su esposo  el señor Sabino quien es campesino, tienen una hija de 17 años que cursa actualmente el 2° de la preparatoria.
Inés tiene un negocio donde vende Plátanos por racimos y Fritos hechos por ella, Mangos y tamarindo en pulpa o en fruta y otras que por temporadas compra para su venta, dice que le va bien porque lleva 17 años con su negocio y piensa invertir su próximo préstamo en surtir mas su negocio, y con sus ganancias hacer más grande el espacio donde tiene su negocio, porque todos los días tiene que sacar su negocio para que pueda estar a la vista de sus clientes y pues dice que al estar metiendo y sacando su mercancía se pudren, es decir se maduran pronto y eso hace que tenga un poco menos de ganancia por la pérdida de esa mercancía.
Inés es integrante del Grupo San Francisco que está integrado por 10 integrantes, dicho grupo tiene el nombre de la Localidad donde viven ciertos integrantes que a continuación serán mencionadas: Rosa, Galdina, Ricarda, Raquel, Iraiz, Estela, Eneida, María, Inés, Y diana, la cual todas son comerciantes y su negocio son  la venta de: Plátanos, Chilate, Comida, Mangos, Tamarindos, Cocos.
texts.en:
Inés is a very hardworking and responsible woman, which comes with her 43 years. She lives in a common law marriage and her husband Sabino works in agriculture. They have a 17 year old daughter who currently is in her second year of preparatory school.

Inés has a business selling plantains in bunches and fried. She also buys mangoes and tamarind pulp and whole fruit, and other seasonal fruits. She says that things go well for her because she's been in this business for 17 years; she's thinking about investing her next loan in further stocking her business, and with the profits make the space where she has her business bigger. That's because every day she has to take out her goods so that they can be seen by her customers, and she says that putting away and taking out her merchandise causes rotting - that is to say, they mature quickly and because of this she has a little less profit, due to the wasted product. 

Inés is a member of Grupo San Francisco [San Francisco Group], which is made up of ten members. This group has the name of the town where some of members live and will be mentioned here: Rosa, Galdina, Ricarda, Raqual, Iraiz, Eneida, María, Inés and Diana. All of them are businesswomen and their business is the sale of: plantains, chilate [a chocolate beverage], food, mangoes, tamarinds, and coconuts.

loans.use: to buy fruits like mangoes, plantains, tamarinds, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. In the past 3 years, Pauline has been working hard to manage her small business which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Pauline has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resale and will help Pauline to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Pauline hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a bigger business. 

Pauline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Pauline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Matin

texts.en:
Matin is 30 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past two years, Matin has been working hard to manage his poultry, which sells chicken. 

To help expand his business, Matin has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to get more feed for his chickens to improve the egg output, and will help Matin to generate greater profits and increase the supply of eggs. Matin hopes that in the future he will be able to. 

Matin is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Matin who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to get more feed for his chickens in order to improve the egg output.

loans.name: Aiah Prince's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Seidu, Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. These teachers want a loan of 3,300,000 Sierra Leonean Leonean in order to solve their immediate financial needs. And at the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries.

Pictured on the left is the leader of the group, Aiah. Aiah is fifty-seven years old. He is a native of Gandorhun, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a trader and the couple has four children – one in primary school and three in secondary. Aiah has been a professional teacher for ten years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials – iron corrugated zincs, cements, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials – iron corrugated zincs, cements, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house

loans.name: Richard Sard's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is a group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, based in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone, to apply for a loan of 6,600,000.00 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to solve their immediate financial needs and then gradually repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. 

Richard is the leader of this group of teachers. He was born in Samamdu, in eastern Sierra Leone. Richard is sixty years old and he is married with six children – one in primary school, three in secondary school and two are no longer attending schools. A professional teacher for many years now, Richard has applied for this loan in order to buy house building materials – iron corrugated zincs, cements, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials – iron corrugated zincs, cements, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house

loans.name: Abdul's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfiance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of  7,000,000.00  SLL in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for the withholding and repayments. 

Abdul (pictured right) is the leader of this group of teachers. The 48-year-old man is a native of Koquima in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married and has four children – two in primary school, one in secondary school and one not of school going age. Abdul has been a professional teacher for the past twenty-six years. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy house building materials like cements, etc. for the construction of dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like cements, etc. for the construction of dwelling house

loans.name: Husan

texts.ru: Хусан мужчина в возрасе 29 лет, он женат имеет 1 ребенка. В течении 6 лет,он разводит дома скот. У него есть 7 гектаров земли, где в сезонное время выращивает овощи. Хусана жена домохозяйка, но она помогает ему в работе и ухаживать за скотом. У него дома 2 коровы и теленок. Также на даче,он выращивает лук, помидоры и бахчевые культуры. Хусан большую часть скота содержит на даче так как там больше корма и травы. Настоящий кредит использует для покупки  скота.
texts.en: Husan is a 29-year-old man, he is married and has a child. For the past 6 years, he has been raising cattle at home. He has 7 hectares of land, where he cultivates vegetables during the growing season. Husan's wife takes care of the household, and also helps him look after the livestock he keeps at home - 2 cows and a calf. Furthermore, at his dacha Husan grows onions, tomatoes, and melons. This is where he also keeps most of his cattle, since there they have more food and grass. Husan will use this loan to buy additional cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Abanamarimwe Group

texts.fr:
Aline fait partie du groupe Abanamarimwe et  habite à Gitega.	Elle a  25 ans et est mariée à serges,un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants.

Elle  fait le commerce de bananes depuis 7ans.
Elle a aussi une boutique(haricot,riz,sel,...) 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup  de bananes à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Aline is a member of the Abanamarimwe group and lives in Gitega.  She is 25 years old and is married to Serges, a farmer.  They have three children together.

Aline has been selling bananas for 7 years.  She also has a shop where she sells beans, rice, salt... This is her fourth loan with Turame.  With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy large quantities of bananas for resale, in order to make more money.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Alexandra Michelle

texts.es: Alexandra desde pequeña aprendió el negocio de las ventas, sus inicios fueron la venta de golosinas, colas y jugos. Con mucho orgullo nos cuenta que le ha ido tan bien que actualmente tiene una mini tienda. Su casa aunque de caña es propia le beneficia ya que la libra de pagar un alquiler. Su esposo se dedica al reciclaje desde hace 3 años, en sus tiempos libres le ayuda en el negocio pero prácticamente quien lo administra es ella. Su labor empieza desde las 6:30 de la mañana hasta las 8:30 de la noche. Como su horario es flexible le permite atender a sus hijos, 2 están en la escuela del barrio y el menor es a quien le dedica más tiempo por tener 1 año.  Con el préstamo va a comprar víveres, colas, jugos, cuadernos etc. Con el tiempo Alexandra espera que su negocio rinda de tal manera que lo pueda agrandar y empezar la construcción en cemento de su casa.
texts.en:
At a young age, Alexandra learned the business of making sales.  She started out selling candy, colas, and juices.  With great pride, she says that she did well enough to the point that she now has a mini-market.  Even though her house is made out of reeds, she owns her residence and has the benefit of not having to pay rent.  Her husband has been in the recycling trade for three years.  In his spare time, he helps with her business, but she practically manages it by herself.  Her work begins at 6:30am and continues until 8:30pm.  Her schedule is flexible so that she can attend to her children.  Two of them attend school in the neighborhood and the youngest one who is a year old requires the most of her time.  

Alexandra will use this loan to buy provisions, colas, juices, notebooks, and other items.  Over time, she hopes to give her business room to expand by building a house made of cement.

loans.use: to buy provisions, colas, juices, notebooks, and other items.

loans.name: Shahyah

texts.en:
Shahyah is a 24-year-old married woman. She is a conservative woman, unwilling to upload her photo on internet, so the photo is of her husband. She lives in Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan and is the mother of three children.

Shahyah is looking for a loan of 1500 Jordanian dinars for her business. She buys clothing, then resells it. In the future She is looking to open her own store. Shahyah is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Naeema

texts.en:
Naeema is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on internet. Therefore, her son appears in the Kiva profile photo.

Naeema is a 56-year-old married woman from Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan. She supports four family members.

Naeema sells clothes and blankets. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to purchase more quantities of blankets and clothes for trading purposes.

Naeema is looking to establish her shop and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase blankets and clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 50-year-old widow who is a mother of four children. She lives in Idon, Irbid, Jordan.

Aisha is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD so she can improve her project by buying more material to make accessories. She will buy more beads and strings to make accessories.

loans.use: to buy beads and string to make accessories

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre cabeza de hogar de sus 3 hijos a quienes su madre abandonó hace algún tiempo, y debido a esto Manuel tiene la obligación de generar los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Anteriormente trabajaba como maestro de construcción, pero debido a las pocas oportunidades laborales que encontraba se vio en la obligación de buscar otra fuente de ingresos. Fue así como montó una cafetería en la cual no lleva más de 1 mes trabajando, y debido a que la montó con muy bajo capital, Manuel busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos para surtir su cafetería y así poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes.
De esta manera podrá salir con este negocio adelante que le ha generado los ingresos para su hogar en el último mes. Además, espera que con mayores ingresos sus dificultades económicas mejores y así sus 3 hijos tengan la oportunidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Manuel is a gentleman who is the head of his household, which includes his three children.  Their mother abandoned them some time ago, so he was obligated to earn enough money to maintain the household expenses.  Manuel previously worked as a master builder, but since there were few job opportunities, he decided to look for another source of income.  He established a cafeteria in less than a month since very little capital was required.  

Manuel is seeking a loan in order to buy products to stock his cafeteria, which will help him provide good service to his customers.  In this manner, his business can move forward and generate household income, just as it did last month.  He hopes that more income will improve his difficult financial situation and provide his three children with a better quality of life and better opportunities to make progress.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his cafeteria.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a thirty-three-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He has a personal goal of educating his children up to the university since he never had a chance to study due to financial constraints.  He has been in the transport business for the last eight years and with the  income earned he was able to build a semi-permanent house for residence.  He is faced with challenges of high fuel costs and taxes levied on him.  He has a goal of buying land to grow crops and buying another taxi.  Moses intends to use this loan facility to buy tires for his taxi, which have now worn out.

loans.use: buy tires for his taxi

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 34 years old single with 3 children living in Hioma, Uganda.  She owns a grains produce business and the business has enabled her to sustain the family since she is the sole bread winner.  She faces challenges in high price fluctuations and inflation. Her family goal is to educate her children and her business dream is to expand her business to new markets.  Betty needs the loan facility to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: buy groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 35 years old and married. She lives in Al Zarqa, Jordan and is a mother of two children.

Nadia is looking to have a loan of 400 JOD to improve and reorganize her home living conditions so it will look more beautiful. She will paint and repair, and also buy some missing furniture.

loans.use: to improve her house

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is 35 years old and married. She lives in Madaba, Jordan and is a mother of four children.

Hanan is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to expand her project in eggs sales. She will buy more food and needed materials to expand her project and increase the quantites of eggs she produces. Her husband is unable to help her because of his physical disability, so she runs the business on her own.

loans.use: to buy food and other materials for her egg-producing business

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is 23 years old and married with three children. She lives in Madaba, Jordan.

Bayan is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD to improve her home living conditions to make it healthier and more suitable for her family. Her home needs some repair and maintenance, and she would like to buy some missing furniture.

Bayan is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to repair her home and purchase some furniture

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Beth has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Beth has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale, and will help Beth to generate greater profits and boost the business. Beth hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger shopping mall. 

Beth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for resale,

loans.name: Eben Ezer (#1) Group

texts.en: Sinclair, age 33, is married with 2 children ages 2 and 6 years old. He is representing the Eben Ezer (#1) group. He operates a small grocery store in a local market, a business he's had for 8 years. Sinclair will use the loan to buy inventory for his store, including rice, powdered milk, cans of sardines, and assorted drinks. His business strategy is to offer competitive prices and have regular sales to attract new customers. Sinclair has received 3 previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He wants to continue to grow and eventually have a large grocery store one day. Sinclair hopes to be able to help his extended family with their needs with the extra profits from this business.

loans.use: to pay for rice, powdered milk, cans of sardines, and drinks.

loans.name: Tamba

texts.en:
Pictured here is Tamba, 34. He was born in Eastern Sierra Leone and he has three children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary schools. 

For fifteen years now, Tamba has been selling building materials like cement, iron corrugated zinc, etc. 

He is seeking a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the first time from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand his business. With this loan, he will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to his existing stock.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, iron corrugated zinc, etc., at wholesale to add to his existing stock.

loans.name: Zenah

texts.en:
Zenah is a 24 year old woman.  She is married to Steve, who is also a businessman, and they have one 2 year-old child.

Zenah has been in the retail shop business for the last three years, making a monthly income of Kes 9000. She is taking her first loan of Kes 10,000 from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the loan to increase stock.  The anticipated profits she will use to expand her business.  She hopes to have a very stable business that can support her family without struggles.

loans.use: To add retail stock

loans.name: Teodorico

texts.en:
Teodorico is a man full of hopes for his family. He is 57 years old and married with four children. All of his children have been working already in different places. Teodorico is grateful because through his farming business, he is able to support them so they can receive a higher level of education. At present, they all have their own work.

Teodorico started planting rice in 1970. He is happy to see that his sacrifices have a big impact on his whole family. Teodorico would like to maintain his farming business because he doesn't want to depend on his children. Aside from his farming business, he is also engaged in the transportation business because he would like to save for his emergency purposes, since he is getting old already.

With his determination to improve his farm land and develop his rice crops, he is applying for a loan of PHP 30,000 which will be used to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides, and to pay for hired laborers. He hopes that he will be a successful farmer someday through continuous financial support.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides, and to pay for hired laborers.

loans.name: Bako

texts.en:
Bako is 32 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children. One of them is currently in school. Bako has been working hard to manage her small produce business, which sells cassava flour. 

To help expand her business, Bako has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cassava flour for resale, and will help Bako to generate greater profits and construct a house of her own. Bako hopes that in the future she will be able to own a large business. 

Bako is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bako who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Marcelinah

texts.en:
Marcelinah is 46 years old.  She is married to a self-employed man and together they are blessed with four children ranging age from four to 19 years.  

Marcelinah was previously employed but, after fourteen years, she decided to run a school, which is located within a populated residential area in an urban area.  She has four employees who help her with the students.  She is facing the problem of inadequate funds for building more classes.  Therefore, she plans to use the loan of 30,000 KES to pay for the renovation of the school, which she believes will attract more students to the school and hence increase enrollment.  In this way, she hopes to generate profits, which will be used in part to build classes up through eighth grade.  In addition, she will pay school fees for her own children through the university level.   Marcelinah is a patient, determined and jovial woman.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the classrooms.

loans.name: Louise Sidonie

texts.fr: Louise Sidonie est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgé a 14 ans. Deux vont à l'école et elle a une personne à charge. Elle vend du maïs, des savons et autres articles depuis 05 ans. Louise Sidonie s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de Cotonou. Ses clients sont composés des hommes et femmes. Louise Sidonie veut acheter des sacs de maïs et des cartons de savons. Elle ambitionne renforcer son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Louise Sidonie is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school.  Her oldest child is 22 years old, the youngest is 14.  She also has an additional person in her care.

Louise Sidonie has been selling maize, soaps and other goods for the past five years.  She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Cotonou and sells to both men and women.  She wants to buy bags of maize and boxes of soap.  Her ambition is to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of sugar, 5 boxes of milk, 5 boxes of sardines and 4 boxes of various soaps.

loans.name: Abla Béatrice

texts.fr: Béatrice Abla est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 8 ans. Les deux vont à l'école et elle a deux personnes à charge. Elle vend des sacs de maïs et divers depuis neuf mois. Béatrice Abla s'approvisionne dans les marchés Béninois et extérieurs. Elle dispose  d'une clientèle diverse et variée. Béatrice Abla veut s'acheter des sacs de maïs et autres articles. Béatrice Abla avec ses économies veut augmenter son capital. Elle souhaiterait étendre son activité afin d'avoir la grande part du marché.
texts.en: Béatrice Abla is a married mother of two children, the oldest of whom is 12 and the youngest eight years of age. Both her children go to school, and Béatrice Abla has two people in her care. She has sold bags of corn and miscellaneous articles for nine months. Béatrice Abla obtains her supplies from the markets in Benin and the surrounding area, and she has a wide variety of customers. She plans to buy bags of corn and other items, and hopes to use her savings to increase her capital. Béatrice Abla would like to expand her business in order to have a large share of the market.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of corn and various other articles.

loans.name: Leena

texts.en:
Leena is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Majdi appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in the herd next to sheep he owns.

Leena is a 29-year-old young woman. She is married to Majdi and a mother to one son and two daughters. Her husband is employed and earns a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Leena's husband has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the costs.

Leena is requesting a $2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep and improve the herd's condition

loans.name: Dua'a

texts.en:
Dua'a is a conservative woman who is unwilling to upload her photo on the internet. The photo is of her uncle.

Dua'a is 22 years old, married and lives in Nao'or, Jordan.

Dua'a wants to have a loan of 1,000 JOD to improve her home living conditions. Her home needs repair, maintenance and new paint. In the future, she wants to build a new floor above her home to make it wider.

Dua'a is under 30 years old so her loan is a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy paint and other home improvement materials

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Watu na Nuru, which means “Light for the People” in Swahili, is the name of a growing collection of businesses established with the support of the Anglican Church of Tanzania, with the aim of making high-quality, affordable solar lighting kits available to rural communities. 

I have been working in Tanzania with my wife for two years now, and we have been using our previous experiences to help in the development of education and business. We have left two grown-up children to their own careers in the UK. One of the first things that struck me was the limited use of solar power for a country with such a huge amount of sunshine. This was particularly noticeable coming from the UK! When we saw that people were using homemade kerosene lamps at night we felt there had to be an opportunity to make solar lights more widely available. A large part of my work for the Anglican Church was starting a wholesale business to import and distribute solar lights to micro-entrepreneurs and small businesses who want to sell them in villages. Over 80% of Tanzanians have no access to mains electricity and they use dangerous, unhealthy and costly kerosene lamps as their main source of lighting, so there is a huge market for affordable, quality micro-solar kits.

Watu na Nuru needs to have sufficient quantities of the right products at the best time of year (when farmers bring in their harvest). We need funds to ensure product is available when people are ready to buy it. When we are not selling product we provide training and technical support to retailers. We have developed a partnership with Barefoot Power Australia, who make what we believe are the best micro-solar systems on the market. My greatest challenge in this role is to get the right quantity of stock and spares to support the growing business. Your loan will support our stock so that more village entrepreneurs can sell these lighting solutions. My favourite part of this job is seeing a first order of product heading off for a distant part of the country to one of our small retailers just starting a new business.

loans.use: To buy stock of micro-solar lighting kits from Barefoot Power.

loans.name: Nzioki

texts.en:
Nzioki is a married man. He has two children 5 months and 6 years old. He describes himself as a focused man. He operates a garage where he sells and repairs motor vehicle wheels. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy and fast-growing town and his primary customers are businesspeople within the town. 

He says his biggest business challenge is inadequate funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to to buy food ingredients for preparing meals. His business goal is to run many garages in his town.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for opening a new restaurant for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge se encuentra casado y tiene un hijo de 1 año de nacido, a quien le ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida. Desde hace aproximadamente 8 años se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, más específicamente con la producción de leche cuidando unas vacas que ordeña diariamente. Gracias a esta actividad puede generar ingresos con los cuales sostener los gastos que se generan en su hogar. Debido a que su servicio es muy bien reconocido, Jorge ha logrado tener muy buenos clientes los cuales le hacen grandes pedidos, y debido a que en la actualidad su capacidad de producción es inferior a la demanda de sus clientes, busca que un préstamo le permita comprar una vaca lechera para aumentar su capacidad de producción y así poder responder a la demanda de sus clientes.

De esta manera sus ingresos se aumentarán considerablemente, permitiendo brindar una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar. Además, espera que con mayores ingresos su familia pueda tener mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Jorge is married and has a child who is one year old, to whom he wishes to give a better quality of life.  For the last 8 years or so, he has devoted his life to agriculture, specifically in dairy production, by caring for some cows that he milks daily.  Thanks to this business, he is able to make an income sufficient to cover the expenses of his household.

Because his services are well-known, Jorge has been able to find very good customers who request large orders from him, and because currently his production capacity is inferior to the requests of his customers, he is looking for a loan that will allow him to buy a milch cow to increase his production capacity and thus be able to respond to the requests of his clientele.

In this way, his income will be increased considerably, affording him and his family a better quality of life.  In addition, he hopes that with the increased income his family will be able to have better economic opportunities and progress.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase his production capacity and be better able to respond to his customers' needs.

loans.name: Olga Lydia

texts.es:
Olga, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere invertir en su trabajo agrícola el cual está iniciando,  comprara abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, semilla mejorada, esta compra le ayudara para que pueda a buen tiempo comenzar a sembrar.
El ha tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, pues obtuvo los insumos necesarios, los aplico a la siembra, obtuvo buena cosecha, con su familia han cambiado algunas circunstancias, estando mejor que antes.

loans.use: Compra de abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, semilla mejorada.

loans.name: Gs Colinas Del Poteca Group

texts.es:
La Señora Eloisa, tiene 61 años de edad, tiene 2 hijo y es madre soltera, Su actividad principal es la venta de pan, nacatamales, dulces, ropa nueva desde hace más de 10 años, Doña Eloisa, esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de productos como ser: maíz, queso, azúcar, carnes, verduras y ropa para la satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, hace algunos años atrás Doña Eloisa era propietaria de una cantina (venta bebidas Alcohólicas) pero cansada de este tipo de negocio dañino para la sociedad decide cambiarle el rumbo de su negocio desligándose por completo de este y emprende la venta de nacatamales, pan, y ropa nueva y de esta manera deja atrás el pasado y comienza una nueva historia en su vida, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Doña Eloisa, le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia para ayudarla a salir adelante,
Uno de los sueños de Doña Eloisa es establecer una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos y no seguir haciéndolo ambulante y vender una variedad de producto.
La Señora Dimara, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de Hot Dog, papas fritas y Calzado.
La Señora Glenda, se dedica a la caficultura y comercio  su actividad principal es el cultivo de café  venta de Ropa y calzado, compra y venta de ganado.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de maíz, queso, azúcar, carnes, verduras y ropa para su negocio

loans.name: Gs Shadai Group

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria, de 49 años de edad, es casada, vive con sus hijos y su esposo en su casa de habitación, ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, Valle. Doña Gregoria  por  ser la persona que siempre esta pendiente de sus compañeros y que el grupo funcione, fue elegida por sus compañeros de grupo como la líder del grupo solidario SHADAI, se dedica desde hace vario tiempo a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su venta es en su casa ahí llegan sus clientes a comprar sus tortillas.
Doña Gregoria esta solicitando 7,000.00 lempiras para la compra de maíz y leña que son la materia prima que mas utiliza para hacer las tortillas.
El sueño de Doña Gregoria es mejorar su casa y salir bien con sus préstamos.
La Señora Celina, se dedican a venta de abarrotaría y pescado.
Doña Lesly, quien se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de maíz y leña para su negocio

loans.name: Gs La Bendicion Group

texts.es:
La Señora María, tiene 46 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, y es madre soltera, Su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería) tiene 5 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, Doña María, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de su producto como: Arroz, manteca, jabón, azúcar, refrescos, carnes, embutidos, y otros productos para la atención de sus clientes, Doña María es una persona muy trabajadora y su negocio esta ubicado en su casas de habitación, contando con toda la clientela de la zona donde ella habita, negocio que le a ayudado a salir adelante ya que ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Doña María, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia,
Doña María sueña con tener el  mejor negocio de la zona poderlo surtir con todo lo necesario para incrementar su clientela, y mejorar sus ingresos.
Julio, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta agua purificada en galón, en litro y en bolsa, y la venta de mariscos como: pescado fresco, tila pía, camarón y jaiba.
Lourdes, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de  golosinas como: pastel, pizza, tortas, flores decorativas, venta  y elaboración de juguitos.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de Arroz, manteca, jabón, azúcar, refrescos, carnes, embutidos, y otros productos para su negocio

loans.name: Gs El Triangulo Group

texts.es:
La Señora Hojana, tiene 26 años de edad, no tiene hijos y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en los gastos familiares, Su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería) tiene 2 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio.
Hojana, esta solicitando el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de su producto como: Arroz, manteca, jabón, azúcar, refrescos, carnes, embutidos y otros productos para la atención de sus clientes, Hojana, es una persona muy trabajadora y su negocio esta ubicado en su casas de habitación, contando con mucha clientela de la zona donde ella habita, este negocio le a ayudado a salir adelante ya que ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Hojana, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y tener una mejor calidad de vida,
Hojana sueña con tener la mejor pulpería de la zona con todo lo necesario para incrementar su clientela, y mejorar sus ingresos.
Erika,  se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de  golosinas como: enchiladas, tajaditas, carne azada, pastelitos y chilaquiles.
Lidia, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa Americana y ropa nueva.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de Arroz, manteca, jabón, azúcar, refrescos, carnes, embutidos y otros productos  para su negocio

loans.name: Gs El Guasimal Group

texts.es:
Don Norlan, es una  persona  muy emprendedora dedicada a su negocio,  vive  con su esposa  y  sus  2 hijos. En  Choluteca  en  el  sur de  Honduras.  El tiene  más  de 4 años de tener este tipo de negocio. El  préstamo  lo invertirá en  la  compra de maíz, leña, cal, refrescos, azúcar, café, pan, dulces, confites y otros productos de esta manera incrementar más  sus ventas. Con el préstamo  espera  incrementar sus ventas y así atender mejor a sus clientes. Don Norlan espera  tener mejores ingresos para  tener  mejor  forma  de  vida.
Los sueños de Don Norlan  es poder  darles a sus hijos una educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
Enemecia, se dedica  a su  negocio propio pulpería desde hace más de  6 años  en su casa de habitación
Juan, se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos y proceso  de  productos  lácteos.
Choluteca  Honduras - Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, refrescos, azúcar, café, pan, dulces, confites y otros productos para su negocio

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La  Señora Guadalupe, tiene 67 años de edad, no tiene  hijos a su cargo convive con su esposo, Su actividad principal es la venta de Joyas de oro como ser cadenas, aritos, pulseras, anillos y esclavas desde hace más de 14 Años. Doña Guadalupe, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cadenas, aritos, pulseras, anillos y esclavas ya que se aproxima las festividades del día de la madre para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes los que prefieren de sus producto por la buena atención y precio que les brinda a sus clientes, con el préstamo que reciba Doña Guadalupe, le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Doña Guadalupe es una persona mayor y trabaja afanosamente  para manejar todo en orden en su hogar y darle atención a sus clientes, con los ingresos de su negocio logro darle el estudio a sus hijas las que hoy en día son profesionales universitarias y cuentan con sus trabajos como maestras de educación.
Doña Guadalupe uno de sus sueños es ampliar su  negocios y vender una variedad de producto.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de cadenas, aritos, pulseras, anillos y esclavas para su negocio

loans.name: Rut Marina

texts.es:
Rut se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad, y debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para poder sostener los ingresos de su hogar, decidió montar su propio negocio para contribuir económicamente. Fue así como aprendió la actividad de la peluquería y montó su salón de belleza en su casa, ofreciendo a sus clientes un buen servicio. Desde hace unos 4 años viene trabajando con su negocio y sus ventas han venido creciendo cada vez más, lo que le ha permitido tener mejores ingresos. Con el ánimo de llevar mejor sus cuentas, Rut busca que un préstamo le permita comprar un computador para poder llevar las cuentas de su negocio de mejor manera y así poder tener un mejor control de los ingresos y los egresos.

Su sueño es tener un gran salón de belleza que sea reconocido y donde pueda generar empleo, además de poder tener mejores ingresos para su hogar y así también poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Comprar un computador para poder llevar las cuentas de su negocio de mejor manera y así poder tener un mejor control de los ingresos y los egresos.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa es una persona muy emprendedora  dedicada 100% a su negocio, que es  alquiler  de  apartamentos,  Ella vive con su hija. En Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 15 años de tener este tipo  de negocio.
Doña Rosa el  préstamo  lo invertirá en  la  compra  de cemento, arena, ladrillos y mano de  obra para construir una cisterna para almacenamiento de agua. Para poder  atender mejor a sus clientes.
Doña Rosa con las mejoras de los apartamentos espera tener  mejores  ingresos  ya que cobrara mas y así agenciarse de mejores ingresos. Sus sueños  es  poder    darle a su  hija una buena educación  y mandarla a la  universidad
Choluteca  Honduras   23 de  abril   del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos y mano de  obra para mejorar su negocio

loans.name: Soralla Mileide

texts.es:
Soralla se encuentra casada y tiene 3 hijos de 2, 9 y 13 años de edad, y debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para poder sostener todos los gastos de su hogar, decidió montar su propio negocio para contribuir económicamente. Fue así como aprendió la actividad de la confección tomando unos cursos y hace 2 años montó su taller donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros. Por la buena calidad de sus trabajos ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes, lo que le permite tener muy buenas ventas mensualmente, es por esto que busca que un préstamo le permita comprar insumos como telas e hilos para confeccionar unos pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y así seguirá generando ingresos con los cuales sus 3 hijos pueden acceder a una educación de buena calidad, además, toda su familia podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Comprar insumos como telas e hilos para confeccionar unos pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

loans.name: Ciriaca Ramona

texts.es:
La Señora Ciriaca, tiene 57 años de edad, tiene dos hijos es  madre soltera, Su actividad principal es el comercio cuenta con una pulpería desde hace más de 19 Años, Doña Ciriaca, esta solicitando el apoyo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, manteca, carnes, lácteos, embutidos y otros productos para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela, su negocio ubicado esta ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico por donde transitan varios personas lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Doña Ciriaca, le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Doña Ciriaca uno de sus sueños es ampliar su  negocios y vender una variedad de producto.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, manteca, carnes, lácteos, embutidos y otros productos para su negocio

loans.name: Jose Marcial

texts.es:
El señor José, de 65 años de edad, es soltero vive en su casa con sus 4 hijos y dos nietos, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de Refrescos al por mayor y detalle además cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos que son dos molinos ubicados uno en su casa y otro en amapala, El vive en una comunidad de coyolito amapala al sur de Honduras.
Don Jose esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar Refrescos, jugos y reparar el motor de uno de los molinos, con  el préstamo pretende seguir trabajando y mejorando su condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa y aumentar más su negocio.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de Refrescos, jugos y reparar el motor de uno de los molinos para su negocio

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa, tiene 32 años, junto con ella vive sus 3 hijos y su esposo quien también es comerciante y la respalda en cada uno de sus compromisos, como también en el crecimiento de sus actividades. El negocio se encuentra en punto de fácil acceso, para sus clientes, ya que se encuentra por la calle principal y esto se presta para que sea muy visitado.
Doña Luisa el crédito lo necesita para compra de: maíz, frijoles, azúcar, refrescos, embutidos, huevos, pollo, discos, bandas, limas, lijas, aceite etc. el impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es extenderse mas en su negocio, y así darle variedad de productos a sus clientes y de esta manera contrarrestar la demanda que le hacen a diario, de igual manera obtener mejores ingresos para darle una buena condición de vida a su familia.
Los planes a futuro de Doña Luisa es crecer en su actividad  día a día y enviar sus hijos a la universidad.
Choluteca, Honduras – Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de maíz, frijoles, azúcar, refrescos, embutidos, huevos, pollo, discos, bandas, limas, lijas, aceite etc.  para su negocio

loans.name: Yaira Yulieth

texts.es:
La  Señora Yaira, tiene 35 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo vive con su esposo, Su actividad principal es la venta de verduras frutas, carnes y lácteos desde hace más de 4 Años, Doña Yaira, esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de compra de verduras, frutas, carnes y lácteos  ya que su clientela ha crecido y necesita satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes los que prefieren de sus producto por la buena calidad y precios y atención brindada a sus clientes ya que Doña Yaira Junto a su esposo salen a visitar y ofrecerles los productos a sus clientes a las aldeas donde ellos viven, con el apoyo del préstamo que reciba Doña Yaira, le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Doña Yaira ha hecho mejoras a su casa después de que esta se incendiara y perdiera todo, Doña yaira es una persona con deseos de superación y al apoyo brindado y la buena administración de los créditos la Señora Yaira se ha levantado nuevamente, uno de sus sueños es ver sus hijos profesionales universitarios y con sus trabajos para sentirse orgullosa de que ha valido la pena esforzarse por el bien de la familia.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de verduras, frutas, carnes y lácteos  para su negocio

loans.name: Ramona De Jesus

texts.es:
La  Señora Ramona, tiene 65 años de edad, no tiene  hijos a su cargo, cuida dos nietos, es  madre soltera, Su actividad principal es la cría y engorde de cerdos y la elaboración y venta de pan desde hace más de 6 Años, Doña Ramona, esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de concentrado y materia prima para la elaboración de pan y la compra de ropa americana para la venta, sus clientes ha crecido y necesita satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes los que prefieren de sus producto por la buena calidad, y atención brindada a sus clientes ya que Doña Ramona sale a visitar y ofrecerles los productos a sus clientes a los habitantes de su aldea, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido en su negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia
Doña Ramona sus sueños es  tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos. 
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de concentrado y materia prima para la elaboración de pan y la compra de ropa americana para su negocio

loans.name: Leticia Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Leticia de 36 años de edad, es soltera, vive con dos hijos que dependen de ella, los dos asisten a la escuela, tiene casa propia en donde tiene su propio negocio de pulpería en donde atiende un buen numero de cliente que la prefieren por la variedad de productos que ella ofrece, ubicada en una colonia, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Leticia esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar frijoles, arroz, azúcar, Maseca, lácteos, embutidos, frescos, cosméticos, con las ganancias de este préstamo Doña Leticia pretende mejorar su condición de vida ya que tendrá más  productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y esto por ende le generara mejores ingresos a su hogar.
Su meta para su negocio es hacerlo crecer y en cuanto a la vivienda ella vive cómodamente y mas enseguida tiene como meta hacer otros anexos a su casa, para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de comprar frijoles, arroz, azúcar, Maseca, lácteos, embutidos, frescos, cosméticos para su negocio

loans.name: Glenda Yosmary

texts.es:
La joven Glenda tiene 32 años, vive en la zona sur del país, junto con ella vive sus 2 hijos y su madre quien la respalda en sus actividades, como también en cada uno de sus responsabilidades. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto estrategia, donde la fluidez de persona es en grandes cantidades ya que esta a orilla de calle, y esto hace que sea muy visitado. Glenda el crédito lo necesita para la compra de: maíz, cal, leña, harina, leche, manteca, levadura, azúcar etc. el impacto que espera con el crédito, es contrarrestar la demanda de producto que le hace sus clientes, como también generarse mejores ingresos para el crecimiento de su negocio, y con esto darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Los planes a futuro de Glenda es crecer día a día en su actividad, y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
Choluteca, Honduras – Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, harina, leche, manteca, levadura, azúcar etc. para su negocio

loans.name: Elsy Orely

texts.es:
La joven Elsy tiene 30 años, vive en la zona sur del país, junto con ella vive sus 3 hijos los cuales le apoyan en su actividad, su negocio lo hace de manera ambulante en diferentes aldeas y caseríos, aledaños a su aldea donde vive.
